articles/index.html.title: Knowledge Base | SupplyChain365
articles/index.html.summary: 📚 Getting Started With SupplyChain365 Documentation, installation, and configuration guides. 📂 General Information 📄 SC365 General Information 📄 SC365 User License Agreement 📄 SC365 Demo Company Skynet 📄 SC365 Release Note 📄 SC365 Roadmap 📄 SC365 System Requirements 📂 Modules 📄 3PL & VAL 📄 Collaborate and Exchange 📄 Modules Overview 📄 Scheduler 📄 Transport 📄 Warehouse 📂 Components 📄 App 📄 Extension 📄 Portal 📂 Getting Started 📄 Create new company 📄 Create Sandbox 📄 Demodata 📄 Getting Started 📄 How to get extension 📄 How to register 📄 Install Mobile APP 📄 Label Fields 📄 Label Printer Layouts 📄 Label Printers 📄 License Cost 📄 Link Environment 📄 Portal Overview 📄 Register 📄 Update Licenses 📄 ZPLcode 📦 Module Warehouse 📂 Warehouse Extension 📄 How to create warehouse shipments (basic) 📄 How to create warehouse shipments (with item tracking) 📄 How to create warehouse receipt (basic) 📂 Warehouse Mobile APP 📄 How the inbound process with receive works 📄 Show content of a bin on the mobile app 📄 How to change the location on mobile app 🚀 Release Notes SC365 Release Notes 📂 Release Notes Sprint 12-2025 📄 Release Notes - Extension - 2025-12 📄 Release Notes - App - 2025-12 📂 Release Notes Sprint 07-2025 📄 Release Notes - Extension - 2025-07 📄 Release Notes - App - 2025-07 document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", function() { // CONFIGURATION const listSelector = '.kb-list'; const itemLimit = 3; // FIND ALL LISTS const lists = document.querySelectorAll(listSelector); lists.forEach(list => { const items = list.querySelectorAll('li'); const totalCount = items.length; // ONLY RUN IF ITEMS EXCEED LIMIT if (totalCount > itemLimit) { // 1. INITIAL HIDE for (let i = itemLimit; i < totalCount; i++) { items[i].style.display = 'none'; } // 2. UPDATE FOLDER COUNT let container = list.parentElement; let header = container.querySelector('.kb-folder'); // Fix: Check text content safely to ensure we don't duplicate counts // or overwrite the icon <span> if (header && !header.innerText.includes('(')) { // Use insertAdjacentText to avoid wiping out the <span class="icon"> header.insertAdjacentText('beforeend', ` (${totalCount})`); } // 3. CREATE THE BUTTON let btn = document.createElement('a'); btn.className = 'kb-view-all'; btn.href = '#'; btn.innerText = `View all ${totalCount}`; btn.style.display = 'inline-block'; btn.style.cursor = 'pointer'; // 4. CLICK HANDLER (TOGGLE LOGIC) let isExpanded = false; btn.onclick = function(e) { e.preventDefault(); e.stopPropagation(); if (isExpanded) { // ACTION: COLLAPSE (Show Less -> View All) for (let i = itemLimit; i < totalCount; i++) { items[i].style.display = 'none'; } btn.innerText = `View all ${totalCount}`; isExpanded = false; } else { // ACTION: EXPAND (View All -> Show Less) for (let i = itemLimit; i < totalCount; i++) { items[i].style.display = 'list-item'; } btn.innerText = 'Show less'; isExpanded = true; } }; // 5. INSERT BUTTON AFTER LIST list.parentNode.insertBefore(btn, list.nextSibling); } }); });

            Microsoft Business Central Frequantly Asked Questions Modified on Mon, 22 Dec at 3:07 PM Add your Table of content for your FAQ Content creation FAQs Content management FAQs Content creation FAQs How to add callout cards to my content? You can insert callout cards using quick insert How to automatically generate a Table of content for my article? The Table of content can be created based on the heading of each section in an article. Click on TOC on your text editor once you have added the headers using the paragraph format How to track multiple versions for my article? You can navigate to the Versions section of an article to access all the previous versions and to track how your article has evolved How to add a code snippet to my article? To add a code snippet, click on the Insert code icon on the text editor in your knowledge base article. This will open a popup window where you can enter the code that has to be displayed in the snippet as shown below

            This is a sample code snippet

            Content management FAQs How to filter articles based on its properties? Go to the article list views and enter the values based on which the articles have to be filtered How to reorder articles automatically? Go to Manage under the Solutions tab and click on the edit button that appears when you hover over the relevant folder. In the window that opens, click on the Order articles drop-down and select how you want the article to be sorted How to perform bulk actions on articles? Go to the article list views and filter the articles on which you want to perform bulk actions. Then select the bulk action that you would like to perform from the button that appears over the list of articles How to make my folder visible to a specific customer segment? Click on the folder for which you would like to control the visibility and select the Visible to Drop-down. There you can select from the list of customer/company segment that you have already created document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/co.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 APP component Login You can log in with an AzureAD user. In this way, a user can login via the latest security options and this simplifies management. MFA can also be enabled. Warehouse functions Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform warehouse activities. Transport functions Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform transport activities. Defects Register workplace defects in every logistics process with the SupplyChain365 APP. Add photos and descriptions for further handling in the back office. User and group management Group warehouse or transport employees. For warehouse groups it is possible to assign activities to a group. (e.g. group of reach truckers for storage tasks and clearing) Permission sets It is possible to assign preference sets to user groups. With the help of these permission sets it is possible to block functionality for certain users. Resources Assign warehouse and transport workers to resources so that resource planning and costs become transparent for all transport and warehouse activities. Time registrations Record time registrations per warehouse employee, warehouse activity and document. For transport the consignments and trip activities are recorded. Schedule activities It is possible to schedule specific orders for a certain time so that they do not become visible to the employee or specifically to a certain employee or group in the mobile application before a certain date or time. Version management It is possible to view the actual version of the mobile app. Besides that the app checks if all the necessary versions are available that are in use. If the backend required a new version of the app there will be a message shown.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/co.title: Extension | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/co.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 Extension component Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Extension With the help of the SupplyChain365 extension, Business Central can be expanded with additional functionalities. Extension setup data The SupplyChain365 extension provides a function with which setup data (no transaction data) can be loaded so that the system is immediately ready for use. Extension demo data The SupplyChain365 extension provides a function with which a set of SkyNet demo data can be automatically loaded to start direct WMS and TMS demonstration transactions. Role center The Supplychain365 extension provides a specific role in Business Central to have an overview of all the most important processes. Link Business Central to portal To use the Supplychain365 extension correctly, it is important to link Business Central to the portal. This can be done through this functionality. License plates (nested) It is possible to use nested license plates. So it is possible to easily add and remove combined goods to a pallet with a new license plate coupled. Warehouse agent With the warehouse agent it is possible to block document or document line. When one employee is active in the app with the document no other user can open that document or document line. Session list In the extension there is a view to show all active app sessions in the environment.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/co.title: PORTAL | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/co.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 Portal component Introduction to the SupplyChain365 Portal In the Supplychain365 portal, administrative matters can be carried out by a user with administrative rights. It provides insight into consumption and active licenses. It is also possible to manage licenses, users, mobile devices, printers, label layouts and access for external partners. License management Manage SupplyChain365 licenses. Increase or decrease the number of licenses actually needed for mobile users and modules in the SupplyChain365 admin portal on a daily basis. User management Manage SupplyChain365 portal users for management tasks (Admin) and common tasks (Users). Environment management Manage Business Central environments (Production & Sandboxes) and the connection to SupplyChain365. Manage mobile Android devices Add mobile devices and connect them to SupplyChain365 for warehouse workers and drivers. Manage label printers Add label printers that are used in the organization to use in the logistics process. Manage label layouts Manage and edit printing label layouts from License Plate labels to serial number lists. Manage access for partners (collaborate & exchange) Add External Users to SupplyChain365 Chain partners (customers and suppliers) and give them access to your partner portal to collaborate digitally. License and services consumption View the consumption of SupplyChain365 licenses and API services at any time and view monthly overviews. Invoices & payments Insight into the invoices and payments of the current (estimate) and months in the past from the consumption of modules and licenses.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: SkyNet Demo Company | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: SkyNet Demo Company Demo Environment To properly and quickly experience the functionalities of SupplyChain365, a demo company SkyNet has been set up. In a sandbox environment it is easily possible to load the demo data associated with this customer case. Table of Contents Introduction to SkyNet SkyNet Team SkyNet Items Warehouse Execution 3PL Customer Services Introduction to SkyNet SkyNet is a specialized company in the drone industry. They assemble drones and sell ready-made drones purchased from suppliers. Additionally, they maintain an extensive inventory of drone-related items that they produce, assemble, purchase, and sell. Business Model SkyNet operates with a dual focus: Direct Sales: Selling as many products as possible from stock to end customers and retail stores Logistics Excellence: Maintaining precise stock administration through regular inventory counts and corrections Fleet Operations: Operating their own fleet of trucks for supplier pickups and customer deliveries 3PL Services: Providing warehousing and logistics for third parties (webshops and traders without their own infrastructure) Strategic Challenge "SkyNet wants to introduce a new system to support their supply chain execution" Due to the rapid pace of innovation in the drone market, SkyNet must avoid being stuck with outdated inventory. Their focus on supply chain execution encompasses: Production Distribution Storage Fulfillment Transport This end-to-end approach ensures control over the flow of goods from procurement to last-mile delivery. SkyNet Team SkyNet has assembled a dedicated team responsible for implementing a new IT system for their entire supply chain execution. Leadership & Management Karel van Hamond — Supply Chain Manager 📧 karel@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Precision-focused leader who demands 100% error-free logistics Key Responsibilities: Maintaining optimal logistical execution and accurate inventory Overseeing complete logistics process from warehouse to transport Driving automation and digital transformation initiatives Focus Areas: Automated reports, dashboards, and SCOR model KPIs Standards compliance (EDI GS1, OTM) Digital integration with chain partners Vision: Karel pioneered SkyNet's expansion into logistics services, proving genius in terms of inventory velocity and revenue generation. Vanessa Enting — Warehouse Manager 📧 vanessa@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Experienced warehouse operations expert focused on continuous improvement Key Responsibilities: Implementing warehouse automation (barcodes, RFID, RF, Voice, Pick-to-light, Robotics) Optimizing storage strategy based on data analytics Resource planning across all warehouse operations Primary KPI: Total time/cost per order line from "pick list creation" to "ready to ship" Focus Areas: 100% order accuracy Data-driven storage optimization Resource forecasting (daily/weekly/monthly) for inbound, storage, picking, packing, and shipping operations Erik van Eden — Transport Manager 📧 erik@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Ambitious, cost-focused manager with TMS expertise Background: Previously worked as a transport planner at a logistics service provider with advanced TMS systems featuring graphical planboards Management Style: Critical and data-driven Cost-focused transport operations Performance metrics orientation Goal: Prove his value at SkyNet through optimized vehicle and driver capacity utilization Warehouse Operations Team Christina Tingen — Warehouse Employee (Inbound & Storage) 📧 christina@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Efficiency-driven specialist in receiving and storage operations Philosophy: "Things can always be better and faster" Goals: Smart storage strategies for rapid order fulfillment Minimize manual effort and movement Eliminate redundant data entry User Experience Priority: Every click counts — applications must be intuitive and streamlined Jim Bronswijk — Warehouse Employee (Picking & Shipping) 📧 jim@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Outbound operations specialist with advanced picking methodology expertise Focus Areas: Picking, packing, and shipping operations Timely delivery to shipping docks Zone picking and batch picking optimization Experience: Skilled in order consolidation using bin codes on traffic cones for multi-zone picking scenarios Goal: Ensure all orders reach the correct shipping dock at the right time slot for customer delivery Transport Operations Team Lewis Samuals — Transport Employee (Driver) 📧 lewis@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Young, tech-savvy driver eager for automated systems Challenges: Has experienced delivery errors due to inadequate information systems Expectations: Driver app for real-time information access Faster, more accurate assignment execution Digital documentation (no more paper) Goal: Increase trip efficiency while improving delivery accuracy Peter van der Vis — Transport Employee (Driver) 📧 peter@skynetcorporation.info Profile: Experienced driver preferring simplicity and ease of use Technology Stance: Old school approach — will use technology only if it's intuitive Key Requirements: Integrated navigation Easy contact access for delivery locations Automated time registration Cash-on-delivery payment tracking Pain Points: Paper administration, missed documentation, time tracking errors SkyNet Items SkyNet manages a diverse inventory with complex requirements for tracking and handling. Item Characteristics Physical Attributes: Variable sizes (large and small items) Multiple variants (colors, sizes, designs) Different packaging quantities (box, roll container, pallet, piece) Multiple units of measurement (numbers, length, width, height, volume, weight) Identification Systems: Different reference numbers for customers and suppliers Multiple barcode formats RFID capabilities Serial numbers for warranty and customer registration Lot numbers for delivery/production batches Expiration dates for time-sensitive items Serial-Lot combinations (batch + unique serial per item) Item Categories Category Description Commodities Standard purchasing and selling items Assembly Items Require bill of materials (BOM) for assembly Production Items Raw material consumption yielding finished/semi-finished products Inventory Management Strategy Rotation Methods: FIFO (First-In, First-Out) — Default method to prevent aging FEFO (First-Expired, First-Out) — For items with expiration dates ABC Classification: Regular analysis based on sales orders, pick orders, volume, quantity, weight Alignment with warehouse layout and picking location allocation Automated recommendations with manual override capability Dynamic adjustment based on historical data Traceability Requirements: Simple registration of serial/lot numbers used in assembly and production Easy scanning and labeling of barcodes and RFID tags Complete component tracking for assembled/manufactured items Warehouse Execution SkyNet operates multiple warehouse locations strategically positioned for rapid local delivery to customers. Warehouse Infrastructure Locations & Control Methods: Location Control Method Features Hardbox Manual No controlled storage/removal Normbox Manual No controlled storage/removal Corebox Automated Directed put-away & pick with capacity management Storage Structure: Rack zones with designated bins Unique bin codes for precise location tracking Volume and weight capacity management (Corebox) Bin type and zone classification Bin Types & Zones The warehouse utilizes specialized zones for different operational stages: Receive Bins — Incoming goods staging Put-Away Bins — Bulk storage locations Pick Bins — Active picking locations Packing Bins — Order consolidation areas Shipping Bins — Outbound staging Handling Unit Management License Plate System: Items placed on pallets, containers, bins, and boxes Barcode license plates for fast processing Single scan for all items on a handling unit Pre-registration capability for supplier pallets with SSCC codes Benefits: Enter serial/lot numbers only once per handling unit Digital data pre-population for pre-registered deliveries Streamlined warehouse operations Advanced Warehouse Operations Bulk Storage & Replenishment Bulk Put-Away: Items stored in bulk locations on pallets or handling units Automated replenishment order generation Stock movement tasks created based on pick location needs Replenishment Logic: Automatic movement from bulk to pick locations Time-based stock level monitoring Optimized pick location stock levels Inter-Warehouse Operations Transfer Orders: Automatically created based on order planning Ensure right stock in right warehouse for customer proximity Optimize shipping speed and costs Transport Order Sources SkyNet's transport operations originate from multiple channels: Sales Orders — Customer orders requiring own transport Purchase Orders — Supplier deliveries using own fleet 3PL Result Orders — Orders from 3PL customer's end-customers requiring own transport 3PL Customer Services SkyNet leverages their drone logistics expertise to provide comprehensive third-party logistics services. Service Overview 3PL Fulfillment: Webshop customers outsource logistics to SkyNet SkyNet manages inventory not owned by them Complete stock management for third-party products End-to-end delivery services to 3PL customer's customers Pricing Structure Custody Fees: Warehouse location usage charges Storage duration-based pricing Activity-Based Billing: SkyNet charges for all logistics activities based on multiple metrics: Activity Category Billing Metrics Warehouse Operations Goods receipt, storage, picking, shipping Transport Services Delivery, collection, distance (kilometers), time Special Services Cash-on-delivery payments General Metrics Numbers, weight, volume Volume Discounts: Available for high-volume 3PL customers Tiered pricing structure Incentivizes long-term partnerships Operational Benefits For 3PL Customers: No warehouse infrastructure investment required Access to SkyNet's logistics expertise Scalable operations Professional drone-related logistics handling For SkyNet: Revenue diversification Capacity utilization optimization Market position strengthening Industry expertise monetization Summary SkyNet represents a modern, data-driven approach to supply chain execution in the specialized drone industry. Their commitment to accuracy, efficiency, and technology adoption positions them as both a successful wholesaler and a competitive logistics service provider. Key Success Factors: ✅ Precision inventory management ✅ Multi-location warehouse network ✅ Own transport fleet ✅ Advanced tracking systems ✅ 3PL service diversification ✅ Technology-forward approach ✅ Expert team with clear roles and KPIs This demo company provides a comprehensive testing environment for SupplyChain365 functionality across all supply chain execution domains.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: GENERAL INFORMATION | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) supply chain execution software for medium-sized organizations that can be started immediately. Available directly from the Microsoft Azure cloud and 100% integrated with Microsoft Dynamics365 Business Central. Start quickly and easily with Warehouse Execution and/or Transport Execution functions and use the advantages of this modern platform in a short time. The system is easy to use but offers sufficient options for supporting more advanced processes for both Warehouse and Transport Operations in combination with the powerplatform and a modern Microsoft365 workspace. SupplyChain365 consists of 4 modules and a number of components: the Business Central Extension, a portal for management, an App that can be downloaded from the Playstore and the SupplyChain365 API so the system can digitally collaborate with supply chain partners and other systems. Below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: USER LICENSE AGREEMENT | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 General information SupplyChain365 is a software-as-a-service (SaaS) supply chain execution software for medium-sized organizations that can be started immediately. Available directly from the Microsoft Azure cloud and 100% integrated with Microsoft Dynamics365 Business Central. Start quickly and easily with Warehouse Execution and/or Transport Execution functions and use the advantages of this modern platform in a short time. The system is easy to use but offers sufficient options for supporting more advanced processes for both Warehouse and Transport Operations in combination with the powerplatform and a modern Microsoft365 workspace. SupplyChain365 consists of 4 modules and a number of components: the Business Central Extension, a portal for management, an App that can be downloaded from the Playstore and the SupplyChain365 API so the system can digitally collaborate with supply chain partners and other systems. SupplyChain365 User license agreement User agreement SaaS with regard to SupplyChain365 between OPAL Associates BV as Contractor and SupplyChain365 Tenant user as User Parties OPAL Associates BV, having as its address Kerkenbos 1019, 6546 BB Nijmegen, with KvK number 09154054, duly represented for this purpose by Stephan Smink. (the Contractor) SupplyChain365 Tenant Administrator, duly represented for this purpose by the User OPAL Associates BV and User each being a Party and together Parties. Background Contractor has developed and exclusively owns the software SupplyChain365 which makes SupplyChain365 an extension (expansion) for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. SupplyChain365 is a software-as-a-service supply chain execution solution and adds Warehouse management and Transport management functionalities to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The system provides internet web-based technology and mobile applications which are available via Cloud computing. SupplyChain365 increases inventory visibility in the supply chain and enables supply chain partners to collaborate digitally. (The Software). Contractor provides the Software via Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). This means that Contractor offers User access to the Software via the Internet. User wishes to use the Software via SaaS. Contractor wishes to offer User this possibility, under the conditions set out in this agreement (the Agreement). Contractor also works with partners (the Partner) to deliver the Software to Users. A Partner is, for example, a Microsoft Cloud Solutions Provider or Microsoft Solution Partner or Microsoft Dynamics partner. Definitions OPAL BV: Is the creator, developer, owner and supplier of the SupplyChain365 Software. The Software: SupplyChain365 is the SaaS software solution supplied by OPAL BV to end customers and users. Possibly with the help of Partner. SaaS: Software as a Service provides access to software applications via the internet, on a subscription basis. Tenant: Tenant is a hirer or subscriber of the SaaS solution. This is often a company, institution or group. User: A User is a person with an identity with the Tenant who uses the SaaS solution. Microsoft: Microsoft develops, distributes, licences and supports a wide range of computer-related products and services. The SaaS software SupplyChain365 is based on Microsoft products and services and extends the functionality of Microsoft Business Central. Partner: Partner is a Microsoft ICT partner that provides products and services from Microsoft. Specifically, partner is a provider of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central solutions and services. Agreement Permission to use the Software Contractor authorises User to use the Software. Whereby the Contractor remains the owner of the Software. User may not copy the Software. This permission is non-exclusive and non-transferable. User may only use the Software for automating and digitising logistics and supply chain execution processes for its organisation. User needs Contractor's prior consent if it wishes to use the Software for any other purpose. User must register on Contractor's registration website with a valid Microsoft for work or school account. The registration is validated on the validity of an EU VAT number, a valid Microsoft Tenant ID and a valid payment method. After Contractor has approved the registration, User will receive access to the SupplyChain365 portal and an email with further instructions to start using the Software. Registration for the Software can only be carried out by a Tenant Administrator. This is a User of the organisation authorised to enter into such Agreements. By agreeing, completing the registration, the User declares that he agrees with the NLdigital general terms and conditions and User Agreement SaaS of OPAL Associates BV and thereby digitally signs this Agreement. User may import any Office365/Microsoft365 user accounts within the Microsoft tenant. These Users become sub-Users of the Software. User is responsible for the use of the Software by the sub-Users. On the SupplyChain365 portal, Tenant Administrators can add their Office365 users and specify whether or not these Users are given administrator rights within the SupplyChain365 portal and whether they can log in to the SupplyChain365 portal. The portal gives Users access to general functions such as linking devices and printers etc. The portal gives administrators access to functions such as setting access rights for Users, viewing invoices and licence management etc. General terms and conditions The NLdigital general terms and conditions (the General Terms and Conditions) form part of this Agreement. articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: CREATE NEW COMPANY | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to create a new company What is a company? Think of a company as a container that holds information about a legal entity. How to add a new company to Business Central: A new company can be added in the company list page. You can reach this page by clicking the search button or pressing Alt + Q and typing 'companies' in the search bar. From the search results, select ‘Companies’. In the company list page, we are going to make a new company. Click ‘New’, and then ‘Create new company’. Click Next, and then enter the company name. Note: To create a new company, you must be assigned the SUPER permission set. Click Next and choose Production - Setup Data Only. Click Next, and then click Finish. Note: when you create a new company, it takes a few minutes before you can access it in Business Central. The Setup Status on the company page indicates whether the new company is ready yet. If so, you can switch to the new company in My Settings menu. Go to the gear icon menu and select My Settings and then Company. Choose the Skynet Corporation and click OK, and then OK again. You are now in the Skynet Corporation company, and it is ready for use. Note: once a company is created, you can't change its name, but you can change its display name. Below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: CREATE SANDBOX | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to create a sandbox environment What's an environment? Companies in Business Central online exist in what are referred to as environments. There are two types of environments: Production and Sandbox. In short, production environments contain live business data, and sandbox environments are used as a safe place to test things like new business processes or features. If you have access to a company, you have access to the environment it's in. If you have access to more than one company, and those companies are in different environments, when you sign in to Business Central you must specify the environment that you want to work in. Environments are particular to a given area, so if your organization works in multiple countries or regions, you need separate environments for each one. If you have access to a company, you have access to the environment it's in. How to create a sandbox environment Make sure your account has the 'Dynamics 365 Administrator' role set for your tenant. Follow the next steps: Go to Microsoft 365 Administration Center > Users and check your usersâ€™ role assignments. Go to your Microsoft Edge browser, and login to the Dynamics 365 Business Central admin center. In Business Central you can find the admin center under the gear icon button (âš™ï¸). In the Admin center, go to Environments and review the list of your current Business Central environments. Create a new Environment by clicking on the + in the menu. Name your new environment (e.g. SupplyChain365-demo-test), select 'Sandbox' as the type, choose your country and choose the latest version of Business Central. When finished, click 'Create'. It will take a couple of minutes for your new Environment to be created. Go to the company in your newly created Sandbox by clicking the URL: https://businesscentral.dynamics.com/ / In a new Sandbox, you get 2 companies by default. CRONUS (Microsoft's demo company) and an empty My Company. Databases are protected by automatic backups that are kept for 28 days. The backup includes data from any production and sandbox environments in the database. Below a video to understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: DEMO DATA | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to load SupplyChain365 demonstration data How to load Supply Chain 365 demonstration data We have created a new company by the name of Skynet. As you see there is no data available, so to work with data, we must load demo data. Let's start! Loading the Skynet demo data: Go to the Microsoft Edge browser, and login to Business Central. Switch to the Supply Chain 365 Profile Role Center by using the gear icon and My Settings. Select the Supply Chain 365 Profile from the Role list and click OK. From the Role Center main menu, go to Setup and select Demo Data. A new screen will appear. Click the Skynet Demo Data button. The system will ask you whether you are sure you want to insert demo data. Click yes and again yes for confirmation. It will take a couple of minutes to load all the demo data into the current company. When done, close the screen and refresh the Business Central cues to review the changes. Well done! Our demo data was loaded successfully. Now, we can use the demo data. Enjoy! below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: GETTING STARTED | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } Getting started with SupplyChain365 To get started quickly and learn to Operate SupplyChain365, we have created a feature in the SupplyChain365 Extension called "demo-data". Starting from an empty company, this feature will fill Business Central with the information needed to demonstrate & test most of the capabilities and features of SupplyChain365, For the demo-data we use an imaginary company called SkyNet. From the movie picture Terminator featuring Arnold Schwarzenegger. SkyNet is a manufacturer and whole seller of Drones. The demo-data contains customers, vendors, items, orders, locations, employees etc. But more importantly, the demo data is completely configured so that all the features and capabilities are ready to go. This way you do not have to spend time configuring the system before you can use the APP to proces a picking order with a mobile device for example. With every update of the Extension the demo-data will be updated as well to demo and test specific scenarios or new features that have been added. We recommend using a Sandbox Environment with a blank (production setup data only) Company, when you want to get started and learn SupplyChain365 . Installing the SupplyChain365 Extension into a company in a Sandbox environment will not influence any production systems or databases. TABLE OF CONTENTS Getting started Checklist Watch Getting started with SupplyChain365 video Getting started Checklist Before you get started make sure you have followed these steps first: Registered your tenant at: the SupplyChain365 Registration Portal Login to the SupplyChain365 portal at: https://portal.supplychain365.net Install SupplyChain365 Extension from AppSource into your Environment Grant consent on behalf of your organisation Check that you have licenses on the SupplyChain365 Portal > Admin > Licenses Either you have trail licenses from your trail period You have purchased licenses on the portal Link Business Central Environments to SupplyChain365 Portal If you have not completed these steps, please go to How to register for SupplyChain365 and follow these steps before you can get started. Watch Getting started with SupplyChain365 video:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: HOW TO GET EXTENSION | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to get the SupplyChain365 extension Installing the SupplyChain365 extension: Go to the Microsoft Edge browser. Login to Business Central. In Business Central click on the search icon or press Alt+Q and type: 'extension marketplace'. The AppSource page will be opened with a list of all available apps for Business Central. Alternatively, you can go to the AppSource website and install the Extension from there. In the search bar enter: 'SupplyChain365' and press enter. In the search results the SupplyChain365 App will be displayed. By clicking the 'Free trial' button a confirmation window will be displayed. Click the 'Free trial' button again to install the SupplyChain365 Extension. SupplyChain365 has now been installed and is available for all companies within the environment. Watch the SupplyChain365 extension video:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: HOW TO REGISTER for SC365 | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to register for SupplyChain365 Instructions to register for SupplyChain365 Getting started with Supplychain365 is easy and can be done for free for a 10-day trial period for companies with a valid EU VAT number, a valid Microsoft Tenant account (yourcompany.onmicrosoft.com) and a valid payment method. Go to our registration page and fill in the details. You will receive an email with instructions for Supplychain365 . If you already have Microsoft Dynamics365 Business Central then you can easily connect your environment to Supplychain365. If you do not yet have Business Central you can start a trial period of Business Central with Microsoft. TABLE OF CONTENTS Instructions to register for SupplyChain365 Step 1: Go to the registration portal Step 2: Follow the instruction from the registration email Step 3: Install the extension and link you environment SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 1 SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 2 Go to: https://supplychain365.com/register to start your SupplyChain365 journey! Step 1: Go to the registration portal Go to the registration portal and enter your information. You have a valid EU VAT number, a valid Microsoft account (yourcompany.onmicrosoft.com) and a valid payment method. â‚¬0.01 will be debited to validate. Step 2: Follow the instruction from the registration email Follow the instructions sent to you via email. you will receive an email confirming your registration as soon as your Supplychain365 environment is ready for use. Step 3: Install the extension and link you environment Install the Supplychain365 extension via the AppSource MarketPlace and code-link your Business Central Environment to the extension. The system is now ready for use. SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 1: SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 2:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: INSTALL MOBILE APP | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } Installing the SupplyChain365 mobile app Mobile device and application This article cover the following issues: Adding mobile devices deleting mobile devices editing mobile device connecting mobile device and copying installer file to mobile device. If you want to install the mobile application on your Android device go to the admin menu and select Downloads. Then select the APK file SupplyChain365, which is an installer file for Android system. Step-by-step application installation Go to portal.supplychain365.net Click on supplychain365 application (APK) Connect your mobile device to laptop via USB cable and transfer the application Click on the application (APK) and install Open the SupplyChain365 application Downloading the SupplyChain365 mobile application: If you want to install the application on your Android phone, go to admin menu and select Downloads. Then select SupplyChain365-App (APK file), which is an installer file for Android. It will appear in your downloads folder. Next step is to move it to your Android device: First, connect your mobile device and turn on USB debugging mode. Then, copy the SupplyChain365 APK file to your mobile device and select the application to start the installation process. Now, open the application on your mobile device and wait until the screen is loaded. Once you see the screen, use the scan button on your device to scan the QR-code. In a few seconds, the login screen appears . Then, login with your credentials. When a new device is added successfully, you can see information about the device, like its name, brand and model. In the SupplyChain365 portal you can edit and delete the devices that have been connected. Mobile users can download the application from the Supplychain365 Portal or in the Play Store. Below a video to understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: LABEL PRINTER LAYOUTS | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to add label printer layouts to SupplyChain365 What is a label? The most important functions of labels are to describe the product, its usage, cautions in use, and specify its contents. Identification of the product or brand are other important functions performed by labels. In the video below we will show you how to add, edit and delete labels. To create your own labels you need to take the next steps: To add labels click on the component menu, select labels and then click on the new button to create a label. Select a name for the label, for example: Receipt Header or Receipt line. In SupplyChain365 we have various processes like: inventory count header, inventory count line, item, license plate header, receipt header, receipt line. All of these processes have their own properties. In the receipt header process, we have many properties: Number, Location Code, Bin Code, Posting Date, and more. In the receipt line process, we have the following item properties. Source document, source number, item number, description and more. These are the item properties that can be seen on the label and that can be printed. ZPL Code (Zebra Programming Language) ZPL is the language used by all ZPL compatible printers. It is a command based language that is used by the printers as instructions to create the images on the labels. Here I have the codes for the Receipt header process and the Receipt line process. To add the code, you have to make sure it is active. If it is not active, then the label will not be printed. You can make more than one label per process. When itâ€™s finished, in the preview you can see all the information on the label which comes from different processes. Save the label so you can print it later. Note: In part 2 of the video, we will see that it is possible to create a label just by using Zebra Designer software, without any knowledge of coding. It is so easy. Just try it. We are going to create a label for the receipt header process and one for the receipt line process. How to edit and delete labels. Letâ€™s look at a label. Here we can edit a label, for example the receipt header label Click edit and change â€˜Posting Dateâ€™ to â€˜Assign Dateâ€™. Preview it and see how it has changed. When you're finished, save the current changes. You can simply delete a label by clicking the delete button. The item will be deleted permanently. How to create a label with the help of software (without coding). This is in part 2 of the videos below. We use Zebra Designer to create labels and edit labels. Here are the steps: Go to www.zebra.com and select Support and Downloads, then Printer and click on Software Support. Here you find everything available for printers, such as designing barcode labels or cards, drivers, developer tools, device management and security. Here we select designing barcode labels and from the drop down menu go down and click on Zebra Designer. There is a lot of information about the Zebra Designer software. If you want to use this software with extra features, you must download the latest Zebra Designer with license. For now, we use the free version of Zebra Designer. Scroll down till you find the zebra designer installer file with .exe extension. Download and install it. The steps to install are so easy. Just follow the on-screen instructions. Create Label for Receipt Header process and Receipt Line process. In this last video below we will show you how to make a label for the Receipt Header process and a label for the Receipt line process. The steps are really simple. Just follow the on-screen instructions. In the video below we are using Zebra Designer. It's very easy and efficient. Note: Anyone without knowledge of Z P L coding can use this software. This area is called the header, the Receipt header. We will first make a label for this process. This area is called the line, the receipt line. We will also make a label for this process. Let's start the Zebra software and see how labels are made. Part1: Below a video to understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: LABELP RINTERS | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to add label printers to SupplyChain365 This article is about adding label printers to the Supplychain365 Portal A label printer is a computerized device that prints on self-adhesive label sheets and label material. It is typically designed to be connected to a computer that has the necessary software to make up the label prints. Label printers are used in a wide range of applications, including logistics, retail, healthcare and warehousing. How to add a printer to the SupplyChain365 Portal: Click on components. Then click on printers to add a new printer. Here we have no printer at all. Let's click new and fill in the form: name, IP Address, port number, brand, model, description, and, if necessary, serial number. Then click save. A new printer has been added to the SupplyChain365 Portal and is ready to be used. Here you see a list of all the printers with complete information about the device, like name, IP address, port number, and brand. If you want to add a new printer, just click the new button with the plus icon. Here you can edit a printer's details, e.g. if you want to change the IP address or assign a new port number. In order to delete a printer, simply click delete. It is important that your device can connect the printer by IP and port directly in the network infrastructure. below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: LICENSE COST | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to view SupplyChain365 License Cost In the SupplyChain365 Portal click admin and then costs to navigate to Cost current month or Cost overview. On the page Cost current month, all information about your monthly cost is displayed: product name, pricing name, frequency, invoice unit, cost, quantity, days and total. Here you see the total expense of the current month. On the page Cost overview, you will see name, month and year, and status, which shows whether the payment of a particular invoice is open, paid, approved or payment is pending. The last column displays the total costs for that specific month. Below a video to understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: LINK ENVIRONMENT | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to link Environment to SupplyChain365 How to link your environment to SupplyChain365 Now the SupplyChain365 extension is installed. You can also install supplychain365 extension from Microsoft app source website. The next step is to link SupplyChain365 to your Business Central environment. In your Microsoft Edge browser, open a new tab and go to https://portal.supplychain365.net/. Login with your Microsoft work account. Only a user with admin rights can link environments. Go to the admin menu > Users and grant permission on behalf of your organization. You only have to do this once in the Users page. Karel can import the office users of the organization. As you can see, Karel is an admin user. Now go to the admin menu. Select environment and click Register environment. A link code will be generated. Next, click â€˜Copy to clipboardâ€™. Go to the business Central window and open the SupplyChain365 Role Center. In the Supply Chain 365 Role center, go to setup in the main menu and click Link Portal. Now paste copied link from clipboard by pressing CTRL + V, linked successfully now you can use SupplyChain365 in business central. Below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: PORTAL OVERVIEW | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to use the SupplyChain365 Portal (overview) The SupplyChain365 portal is a gateway between users, components and the logistics system. This is how to log in to the SupplyChain365 Portal. First go to https://portal.supplychain365.net. Then click log in to enter the main page of the SupplyChain365 Portal. Note: the SupplyChain365 Portal works with your companyâ€™s registered email address. Here we see a number of different menus. Letâ€™s look at them one by one. On the right side, there is the SupplyChain365 logo. By clicking it you see the current user and the sign out button. Next to the SupplyChain365 logo, you see the language menu where you can choose between different languages. With the buttons on the left side, you can navigate to all the important pages, such as the home page that displays which organization is currently using the SupplyChain365 Portal. The components menu consists of different options like labels, printers, devices and more. The admin menu consists of administration and management options regarding different aspects of the SupplyChain365 Portal. The last one is the help button, with which you can navigate to the support portal, where you will find information about the Supplychain365 Portal. In upcoming videos we will jump deeper into each of these menus. Below a video to understand the steps in an overview:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: How to register for SC365 | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to register for SupplyChain365 Instructions to register for SupplyChain365 Getting started with Supplychain365 is easy and can be done for free for a 10-day trial period for companies with a valid EU VAT number, a valid Microsoft Tenant account (yourcompany.onmicrosoft.com) and a valid payment method. Go to our registration page and fill in the details. You will receive an email with instructions for Supplychain365 . If you already have Microsoft Dynamics365 Business Central then you can easily connect your environment to Supplychain365. If you do not yet have Business Central you can start a trial period of Business Central with Microsoft. TABLE OF CONTENTS Instructions to register for SupplyChain365 Step 1: Go to the registration portal Step 2: Follow the instruction from the registration email Step 3: Install the extension and link you environment SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 1 SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 2 Go to: https://supplychain365.com/register to start your SupplyChain365 journey! Step 1: Go to the registration portal Go to the registration portal and enter your information. You have a valid EU VAT number, a valid Microsoft account (yourcompany.onmicrosoft.com) and a valid payment method. â‚¬0.01 will be debited to validate. Step 2: Follow the instruction from the registration email Follow the instructions sent to you via email. you will receive an email confirming your registration as soon as your Supplychain365 environment is ready for use. Step 3: Install the extension and link you environment Install the Supplychain365 extension via the AppSource MarketPlace and code-link your Business Central Environment to the extension. The system is now ready for use. SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 1: SupplyChain365 Registration Video instruction Part 2:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.title: UPDATE LICENES | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/ge.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } How to update your SupplyChain365 licenses In the SupplyChain365 Portal, click on admin, then licenses. Here we see two different kinds of licenses: First. SupplyChain365 licenses, and second, external licenses. For example, the license for Microsoft Business Central users. SupplyChain365 provides licenses for the various modules: Warehouse, Transport & Delivery, Collaborate & Exchange, Third Party Logistics and Value Added Logistics and Scheduler. For example, we want to buy a warehouse server license and warehouse device licenses for 5 workers. Simply click on admin, then licenses and select warehouse. Here we see Warehouse & Logistics Extension and Server. We activate it for 25 to 49 users, which costs 500 Euro per month. Below we see Warehouse & Logistics Device. Here we select 5 and click on the checkout button. Then click "I accept the general terms and licensing terms" and then the checkout button to complete the order. Note: This is a minimum price, actual prices can be higher based on size of your organization. This license will result in extra monthly costs based on usage of certain resources. See the license description. Now the order is being processed. Also, on the External Licenses page a user can buy licenses for essential users, team members, device users and premium users. Simply increase the counter, add to cart and checkout. Below a video to understand the steps visually:

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.title: 3PL AND VAL | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: 3PL & Value added logistics 3PL customer definition Create 3PL customers and record all customer data. Use the integrated CRM system for 3PL customers. 3PL items Create items for a specific 3PL customer so a 3PL partner can store items in the warehouse. 3PL Inbound orders Register incoming inventory from 3PL customers using 3PL inbound orders. 3PL Outbound orders Register 3PL result orders to store stock on behalf of the 3PL customer to the right client. 3PL integration WMS and TMS Use the integrated modules of Warehouse & Transport to perform 3PL activities and register them in the system. Inventory management for third parties Keep track of which stock and items of which 3PL are customers. Use the integrated WMS third-party inventory management system. 3PL & VAL activities Automatically register all warehouse and transport activities per 3PL customer and link rates with scales to this. 3PL invoice Automatically generate invoices for warehouse and transport activities carried out for 3PL customers. Adjust the invoice for sending and booking. 3PL VAL reports Reporting to a comprehensive specification from a certain period of time to show all 3PL VAL activities.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.title: COLLABORATE AND EXCHANGE | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Collaborate & Exchange Partner portal login Via the portal it is possible to invite partners to provide insight into the administration. For example, a supplier can view purchase orders and warehouse receipts. A customer can view the sales orders and warehouse shipments. Finally, a 3PL client can view the 3PL incoming and outgoing orders, warehouse receipts and shipments and an up-to-date insight into warehouse stock per location. Company details Through the company details you can view the details of the company and its contacts. Documents customer A customer can view the sales orders and warehouse shipments. Views can be saved and exported to Excel. Documents vendor A supplier can view purchase orders and warehouse receipts. Views can be saved and exported to Excel. Documents 3PL customer A 3PL client can view the 3PL incoming and outgoing orders, warehouse receipts and shipments and an up-to-date insight into warehouse stock. Stock information A 3PL client can view de actual stock in the warehouse, the different locations that are available and the license plates that are used. Views are made and saved by the client and exports are possible to Excel. EDI Wizard profile Within the wizard profile the partner can choose the way how files are exchanged (by services like OneDrive and Storage Accounts). EDI Wizard template Within the template wizard it is possible to map the fields from EDI to business central fields of the documents that are used in the process.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.title: SupplyChain365 Modules Overview | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.summary: SupplyChain365 Modules Overview SupplyChain365 consists of modules that can be activated by enabling them under Admin > Licenses in the SupplyChain365 portal. Each module contains specific functionalities that are important for the relevant processes. Available Modules 📦 Warehouse Module Transform your warehouse operation and eliminate paper processes. Optimize inbound, storage and outbound of goods using barcode scanning or RFID. Use integrated wireless mobile technology to collaborate in real-time between the back office and the logistics shop floor. Key Features: 📱 Mobile Technology — Real-time collaboration between back office and warehouse floor 🔄 Workflow Automation — Automate routine tasks with intelligent workflows 📊 Automated Inventory — Quick inventory counting with mobile barcode scanners 🏷️ Tracking & Labels — Register serial numbers, lot numbers, and print barcode labels 📦 Pallet Management — Process pallet deliveries using license plates as logistic units 📡 RFID Support — Advanced tracking with RFID technology 🚚 Transport Module Digital transformation of the transport process, delivery and collection of goods. Easily convert orders to transport orders with comprehensive planning and tracking capabilities. Key Features: 🗺️ Real-Time Tracking — Monitor trip progress and driver/vehicle position on live maps 📋 Assignment Management — Assign drivers and trucks, plan trips automatically or manually ✍️ Digital Documentation — Collect signatures and data from every job and trip in real-time ⏱️ Time Recording — Track start and end time of each order and consignment 📝 Custom Data Collection — Set up question paths to collect additional transport activity data 🚪 Dock Scheduling — Schedule vehicle docking times with integrated warehouse pick and load capabilities 🔗 Warehouse Integration — Seamless coordination between transportation and warehouse operations 🤝 Collaborate & Exchange Module Specialized module for companies that need to collaborate and exchange data with external partners in their supply chain ecosystem. Key Features: 🔄 Data Exchange — Seamless integration with chain partners 📡 EDI Support — Electronic Data Interchange capabilities 🤝 Partner Collaboration — Real-time information sharing with suppliers and customers 📊 Visibility — Complete supply chain transparency across organizations 🏢 3PL & VAL Module This module is especially designed for transport and storage companies that perform logistics for third parties (3PL - Third Party Logistics). Key Features: 👥 Multi-Client Management — Register inbound, storage, and outbound per client 📊 Real-Time Stock Positions — Easily report stock positions per client 📍 Stock Tracking — Keep track of which stock has been where, for how long 🚛 Cross Docking — Efficient cross-docking to minimize waiting times for loading/unloading 💰 Rate Management — Set charging rates per client and per activity 📈 Automatic Reporting — Automated custody fee reporting per 3PL customer 🔗 Module Integration — Works seamlessly with Warehouse, Transport, and Collaborate & Exchange modules Benefits: Complete 3PL process execution Transparent billing per client Efficient operations for multiple customers Real-time visibility for all stakeholders Module Activation To activate modules in your SupplyChain365 environment: Navigate to Admin > Licenses in the SupplyChain365 portal Select the modules you need for your operations Enable the selected modules Configure module-specific settings as required Module Integration All SupplyChain365 modules are designed to work seamlessly together, providing a comprehensive supply chain execution platform: Warehouse + Transport — Complete logistics operation from storage to delivery 3PL & VAL + Warehouse + Transport — Full 3PL service capability Collaborate & Exchange + All Modules — Extended ecosystem collaboration Choose the modules that best fit your supply chain execution needs and scale as your operations grow.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.title: SCHEDULER | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Scheduler Definition Scheduler Definition With the help of the definition it is possible to make information about transport orders, trips, drivers and cars graphically transparent. Via the definitions you can select what should be shown. Scheduler Use the graphical planning board to provide graphical insight into the occupancy of transport orders, trips, drivers and cars (with information from the definition).

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.title: TRANSPORT | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Transport execution Auto definitions Capture car data in the system and schedule it as a resource. Specify type, load volume, load weight, EuroNorm, number of axles etc. Transport drivers & Resources Assign transport employees (drivers and co-drivers) to resources so that time tracking, resource planning and resource costs become transparent for all transport activities. Consignments A transport consignment with a linked actions to pick up or bring goods (loading/unloading) Tripplanner Trips are the entities that are actually planned and assigned to cars and transport employees. Sequence planner Let the system calculate the best order for executing multiple transport orders. Geocodering Automatically obtain geo location codes of addresses when creating transport orders and trips. Record geolocations for addresses in the reuse system. Trip information on map View the calculated ride and sequence on a map and make any adjustments to optimize a ride. Auto trip planning Based on the transport orders and available cars and drivers, create an automated planning and sequence and adjust it manually if necessary. Integration WMS Let TMS and WMS work together in an integrated way by planning warehouse operations based on transport orders and trips.## Dock planning Use trip dock planning and warehouse jobs to prepare inventory for the right dock. OTM (Open Trip Model) Use the Collaborate & Exchange module to work with OTM-based customers and suppliers to obtain transport orders and provide feedback on status. Real-time map and vehicle data Use the SupplyChain365 vehicle IoT module for real-time vehicle data and show the current position of vehicles on a map. Emission calculation Make automatic emission calculations per transport order and trip. Toll road Automatically generate and calculate toll roads data per transport order and trip. Loads/Consignments A consignment is stock with a destination and has certain dimensions and weight. Transport Rates Rates based on mileage, weight, volume and a combination thereof including graduated calculations. Automatic transport costs calculation Let the system automatically perform transport cost calculations per transport order, trip and client. Invoice Generate transport costs invoices for clients based on all transport activities. SupplyChain365 TMS workflows Automate transport transactions and automatically create documents and transport activities by arranging a workflow and providing parameters. Questionary paths Make question paths in multiple languages that must be handled by the driver in the SupplyChain365 TMS APP. Use fields such as text, selection sequence (multi) selection dropdown (single), photo, GPS data, date/time, scan barcode and capture signature. Driver APP Use the SupplyChain365 TMS drivers APP for time registrations of trips and transport orders and recording transport activities. The driver can show all trips in the future that are planned. Reports It is possible to print reports of the consignments and trips before and after. In this way, the process can also be carried on paper. Of course, the advice is to use the driver app. Automatic trip planning It is possible to automatically schedule all consignments on trips via Supplychain365by means of the PTV trip planning that is available as standard in the solution. Additional transactions are charged for this.

articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.title: Warehouse | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/gettingstarted/mo.summary: /* This creates a general setup for THIS page only */ p, li { text-align: justify; } SupplyChain365 SupplyChain365 Features: Warehouse execution Introduction to Warehouse execution The SupplyChain365 Warehouse and Logistics solution consists of the Extension and the mobile application. Mobile App Use SupplyChain365 mobile App on Android mobile scanning device to perform warehouse activities. Mobile App WMS settings Set parameters for each warehouse activity and automate the logistics flow per warehouse location. Serialnumbers / Lotnumbers Register serial and lot numbers using barcode scanning or RFID on the mobile device with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. SupplyChain365 WMS workflows Automate warehouse transactions and automatically create documents and warehouse activities by arranging a workflow and providing parameters. Break-bulk Change the packaging unit in the logistics process (from pallets to boxes from boxes to pieces) by using the break-bulk function. Create License Plates Create license plates (logistics units: pallets/containers, etc.) and move large amounts of stock on entry, storage and removal with one barcode scan. Change location Create settings by warehouse/branch assign warehouse users and easily switch between locations. Receive Receive of goods and automatic booking of warehouse receipts including Licenseplates, serial and lot number registration. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Require receive item scan, Scan receive bin first, Batch Posting, Require scan every item, Allow over-receipt, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Use Suggested CrossDockBin in receiving, Scanning of a serial number is required, Enable license plate recording. Put-Away Storage of goods in the warehouse using barcode scanning. Register which goods are placed at which storage locations (bins). Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Always automatically create a put-away, Create a put-away when receipt complete, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a Serial number is required. Order picking Process pick jobs using the SupplyChain365 WMS APP on mobile devices with barcode scanners. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Auto open Header, Auto open Line, Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a serial number is required, Breakbulk flow required. Zone / Batch / Tote picking Collect multiple orders in one run and place items directly in shipping boxes or crates with one or more boxes/crates per order. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Movements / Replenishment Move inventory in the warehouse, process replenishment tasks with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. The mobile process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings: Auto open Header, Auto open Line, Place all Items, Enable scanning of serial numbers, Different Bin confirm required, Scanning of a serial number is required Ad hoc movements Register ad hoc movements with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP and process them automatically. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Shipments Book warehouse shipments and print labels and packing slips with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Loading/unloading Use loading lists when WMS works with TMS for loading and unloading shipments. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Inventory/Counting Create periodic inventory counting lists and check the stock status using the barcode scanning and the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Input by keyboard manually or scanned by RFID or barcode. Bin content Check the contents of a storage location (bin) using the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Article availability Search for items at warehouse storage locations by scanning item number or barcode with the SupplyChain365 WMS APP. Adjust units of measurement Add units of measure to items or adjust units of measure. For example: length, width, height, weaving, packaging. Kitting – make/break Licenseplate Use the mobile app to pack items together from a single order or to repack items in new packaging. The consumption of packaging material and a new license plate can be activated. Printing labels Print barcode/RFID labels in any warehouse process of items, orders, order lines, serial numbers, lot numbers and license plates. Connect Bluetooth scanning devices Use external Bluetooth scanners and connect them to the SupplyChain365 APP on the mobile device. Block Items, Serialnumber & Lotnumbers Items, Serialnumbers and Lotnumbers may be blocked for further logistics handling (picking, shipping, receiving etc.)

articles/knowledgebase/m3plandval/3plcos.title: | SupplyChain365
articles/knowledgebase/m3plandval/3plcos.summary:
How to Add Costs and Dimension for Specific Warehouse Activities and Item

Modified on Mon, 17 Jun, 2024 at 1:38 PM Add costs and dimensions for specific warehouse activities go to Business Central select navigation menu 3PL and VAL and from the navigation bar select 3PL customers. here you see all 3PL customers select one customer to add cost and dimensions. this is a general fast tab, scroll down till you find the SupplyChain365 3PL and VAL fast tab, Toggle on enable 3PL option if not enabled. On 3PL activity prices you see a list of warehouse activity like, Service: indicate service code. Service description: indicates which sort of warehouse service is this, whether is it a warehouse or transport service or whatever else it is. Type: indicate for which process is this service here you see a list of all processes like pick, put away, storage, movement, receipt, ship, etc. Dimension: indicate dimensions for current activity like size, weight, and handling. Dimension value, according to dimension, you can select its value, for example, size dimension include large, small, and medium sizes. if the size is small the price is low if the size is large or medium the price will be higher. Sales price: indicate the price for activity per day. you must set the price according to its dimension. sales unit of measure: indicate measurement for an activity like box, piece or carton. On 3PL items you see a list of items with different variants and descriptions: Item number: this is the number of 3PL items. Variant code: this is a variant of the item like red, Black, etc. Description: describe the item details. These are the steps on how to add cost and dimension for a specific warehouse activity. below a video to help users understand the steps visually:

            How to create a 3PL customer Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 5:08 PM What is third-party logistics (3PL)? Third-party logistics, or 3PL, is the practice of outsourcing logistics and supply chain management functions to external service providers. These providers offer a range of services, including warehousing, transportation, inventory management, packing, incoming and outgoing bulk or single items, and order fulfillment, allowing businesses to streamline operations, reduce costs, and focus on their core competencies. Creating 3PL customers: there are two ways to create 3PL customers. By creating a new 3PL customer Go to Business Central click 3pl and val navigation menu and select 3PL customers from the navigation bar. Click on + plus icon to create a new 3PL Customer. Enter 3PL customer information like name, address, and contact details, and scroll down till you find Supplychain365 3PL and VAL. Toggle on the Enable 3PL option and choose a photo of the customer (if available). By changing an ordinary customer to a 3PL customer. Go to Business Central Choose the search icon, enter customers, and then choose the related link Click on an ordinary Customer who is not a 3PL customer. Here (is a 3PL customer) column must not checked. Click on the customer and scroll down until you find the supplychain365 3PL and VAL settings. Toggle on the Enable 3PL option to convert the customer to 3PL. To create stock for a 3PL customer, it is important to do this via an incoming 3PL order. The stock is then available in the warehouse specifically for this 3PL customer. After the 3PL Customer has been created, it is possible to convert existing stock via the 3PL Stock migration function or to create new stock by creating a 3PL Inbound order.             How to Add Dimensions for Items Modified on Mon, 17 Jun, 2024 at 1:38 PM Dimensions in Business Central In Business Central, dimensions are used to categorize business data and provide the ability to filter, group, and analyze information. Dimensions allow for a more detailed analysis of financial data by providing additional context to transactions. They can be used to track specific attributes such as Handling, Size, Weight, or Color. Go to Business Central click on the search icon type dimension and select dimension administration. Here you see 3 types of dimensions so you can add a new dimension or remove the current dimension if it is not used in budget entries. Code: indicate code of dimension. Name: indicate the full name of the dimension. Code Caption: it’s a caption for a dimension code. Filter caption: show a caption on dimension filtering. Description: provide more information about dimensions. Blocked: indicates that the dimension is active or inactive. 3PL invoice: can be used in 3pl invoice or not. This is the general information about the dimensions and if you would like to see the value of dimension click on dimension and then choose dimension value. Here you see different dimension values for different dimensions. Handling: has easy, hard, and normal dimension values. Size: has large, medium, and small dimension values. Weight: has heavy, light, and medium dimension values. How to add dimension to an item? Here is how to add dimension to an item go to Business Central: Select warehouse and logistics. Select items (select the item to which you will add dimension) On the item card page click on the item then the dimension Here you select different dimensions for the item Handling: easy, hard, and normal Size: large, medium and small Weight: heavy, light, and medium After adding dimensions close the page and now the item has three different dimensions. Add price to dimension. Select 3PL and VAL. Select 3PL customer and select a 3PL customer card. On the Customer card page scroll down till you see 3PL Activity prices Select a service number and type for warehouse activity. Here you select the dimensions for the activity. And here enters the price for the dimension and warehouse activity.             What is the difference between a customer and 3PL customer Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 5:11 PM Logistics is the overall process of managing how resources are acquired, stored, and transported to their destination. A company that provides 3PL services provides logistics services for other parties, for example, transport or warehouse storage (Skynet). A customer is an individual or business that purchases another company's goods or services. Customers are important because they drive revenues. A 3PL customer is a customer for which the company arranges logistics. In the customer card, you can set whether a customer is a 3PL customer or not, and you can determine the values of the 3PL activities (pick, put-away, storage, etc.). For a 3PL customer the inventory is stored, picked, packed, and shipped by a third-party company. See in Business Central: login to Business Central Click on the search icon type ‘customers’ and select the customers list. in the customer list page on the left side, you see a column ‘Is 3PL customer’. if it’s checked then this customer is 3PL if not checked then this customer is not a 3PL customer. Note: Refer to the How to Create 3PL client instruction if you wish to add or create a 3PL client. Business Central standard option to record own stock If you buy your own stock, stock with a value will be placed in the warehouse and will disappear again when it is released We also call this 1PL, where PL stands for Party Logistics. There are service providers who can take over the logistics operations for a company. 3PL or Third Party Logistics consists of outsourcing a large part or even the entire logistics process of a company to an external logistics operator. The 3PL acts as an intermediary between the client and its customers, organizing transport activities and storage facilities.Supplychain365 makes this possible in Business Central. The work in the logistics process is then carried out and these can also be charged to the 3PL client per activity. In this way, goods can be centrally stored in large quantities and sent separately to customers at the request of the 3PL client.
