            How to use workflows in the warehouse proces Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:30 PM In this video, How to use workflows in the warehouse process. Workflow automation examples in Business Central. Create new workflow. What is a workflow? A workflow is a series of activities needed to complete a task. Workflow automation shifts the execution of those activities from humans to software. To automate a workflow, an organization first identifies the tasks that make up the job. Next, it creates the rules and logic that govern how those tasks should be done, Finally. it programs the software with the predefined business rules and logic. The rules and logic are often a series of if and then statements that act like instructions telling the program what actions to take and how to move from one task to the next. The software uses those rules and logic to perform the series of tasks from start to finish, so that humans no longer need to handle the job. Workflow automation examples in Business Central: Below are five examples of tasks that workflow automation can handle in SupplyChain365, Create warehouse receipt, when an incoming 3PL order is released. Create incoming 3PL order, when and outgoing 3PL order is released. Create Document from EDI Document, when EDI Document is added. Create transfer warehouse receipt when a transfer shipment is posted. Create warehouse shipment when a transfer order is released. How to use workflows in the warehouse process, Go to Business Central, select the role of SupplyChain365 manager, Click on search and type workflows, Select Workflows, Lists and you will see that currently we have different workflows, but we can add more workflows or remove current workflows. Create new workflow. There are three different ways in business central which you can create a workflow. New workflow from template, Copy a workflow, create New workflow, to create an instant new flow, complete the following steps, Add a new flow from Business Central: Sign into Business Central. Click on search icon and type, workflow. In the workflow screen, select New From new workflow from Template drop-down menu then click New. The workflow page opens and fill in the form: Code represents name of workflow. Type WAREHOUSE-PICK Description shows more information about the workflow. Type WAREHOUSE-PICK Category assign the current workflow for a specific user. Keep it blank. Enabled, after you set workflow steps then you must enable it to use it in SupplyChain365, In workflow steps we have, When event, click on chose a value, scroll down, and select SupplyChain365, when a warehouse pick for a shipment is registered. On Condition, by default, it set to be always, but you can make changes on it. And here I set the value to default. Then response, click on select response and in chose a value I select show message and type my message, Pick Registered Successfully! Close the window. Create new warehouse shipment Create pick for item to be shipped And register the pick to see the workflow. Note: Don’t forget to turn on “enable” option in the workflow page. here you see the message that we have been set in workflow. it means our workflow works as it should. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            How to work with the Role Centre of SupplyChain365 Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:30 PM Role Centre of SupplyChain365 The Role Centre is the user's entry point and home page for SupplyChain365. You can develop several different Role Centres, where each Role Centre is customized to the profile of the intended users. We have 4 different roles in SupplyChain365: SupplyChain365 – Manager SupplyChain365 – Warehouse & Logistics SupplyChain365 – 3PL & VAL SupplyChain365 – Transport & logistics How to set up: Go to Business Central. In the upper right corner of the screen, you can see the gear icon (⚙️), where you will find My Settings. At the top of the pop-up window, you will see Role, which indicates the role of the current user. For example: KAREL has the role of manager in SupplyChain365. Click on the kebab menu (three dots) on right side of the Role field to change the current user's role or see other roles. General information Here the general information about the roll center: At the top of the page, we have the application bar. On the left side, we can see the application name and on the right side you see a company icon which you can click if you easily want to select a different company. Next to the company icon we can find the search button, which allows you to search through Business Central. Notification indicates whether there are any notifications. Next, we find the Setup, which we can use to design a page, inspect a page, and change my Settings. Next, you will find the Help button, which will help you with all aspects of Business Central (SupplyChain365). The last Icon indicates the current user, which you can use to sign out from SupplyChain365. Just below the application bar we find the Navigation Menu. Click on it to see the Navigation bar. The area below it is called the Headline. It displays business data which has been selected as the most relevant. On the right-hand side there is a list of actions. The list of actions gives you quick access to certain tasks. We then have several Activity Queues. The Activity queues can be divided into data queues, which display aggregated business data, and action queues, that link to a task or an operation. All these queues, the navigation menu and the navigation bar will be dependent on which role centre we have chosen. This is the Manager Role Centre, so the information that is displayed here will be relevant for a manager. SupplyChain365 – Manager Go to Business Central and select the role of Supplychain365 - Manager. A manager has full access to SupplyChain365 as you see in the navigation menu. Everything is available for the manager. By clicking on one of the buttons in the navigation menu, all underlying navigation bars will be displayed. On right side we have actions to do tasks quickly. Here we have action buttons for everything in our company, like inbound, outbound, storage, transport, and license plates. These actions are limited for other roles. Also, in activity queues you have access to different warehouse, transport and 3PL activity. It means that we have access to everything, and we can use every part of the system to manage things easier. SupplyChain365 – Warehouse & Logistics Go to Business Central and select the role of SupplyChain365 - Warehouse and Logistics. A warehouse and logistics employee has limited access to the warehouse navigation menu and its navigation bar. Also, in the activity queue you only see activities related to warehouse. On the right-hand side, we have actions to do tasks quickly. Here we have action buttons for warehouse and logistics, like inbound, outbound, storage and license plates. SupplyChain365 - 3PL (3rd-party logistics) & VAL (Value-added logistics) Go to Business Central and select the role of SupplyChain365 – 3PL & VAL. A 3PL employee has limited access to the 3PL navigation menu and its navigation bar. Also, in the activity queue you only see activities related to 3PL. On the right-hand side, we have actions to do tasks quickly. Here we have action buttons for 3PL and VAL, like Incoming 3PL orders, outgoing 3PL orders and 3PL items for Customer. SupplyChain365 – Transport & logistics Go to Business Central and select the role of SupplyChain365 – Transport & Logistics. A transport employee has limited access to the Transport and logistics navigation menu and its navigation bar. Also, in the activity queue you only see activities related to Transport and logistics. On the right-hand side, we have actions to do tasks quickly. Here we have action buttons for Transport and logistics, like consignment, trip, vehicle types and resource.             How to work with the gamification option of the pick process Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 4:21 PM Here we will describe how to work with the gamification of the pick process. Here the steps to get a happy face: Choose the search icon, enter locations, and then choose the related link, Choose the location CORE BOX in locations page, Scroll down for advance Supply Chain 3 65 mobile settings, On pick settings enable show pick result screen, Enter 10 second on average pick time, Now we are switching to mobile device and operating from there. On Mobile screen with Pick time shorter than 10 second, Login to supply chain 3 65 mobile application, Select Warehouse CORE BOX as location, Click on picking, Select order to pick, Then select bin and then click next, Select quantity and click pick, Select lot number and serial number, and click assign quantity, select bin to place the item and click on place. the goal is to see which warehouse worker, work fast and not wasting time on picking. now he is happy and says you performed faster than average! this warehouse worker is fast and not wasting his or her time on picking. To check the sad face you can follow the next steps: next part with unhappy face, on Mobile screen with Pick time longer than 10 second. Login to supply chain 3 65 mobile application, Click on picking, Select order to pick and wait for 1 or two second, Then select bin and wait for some seconds then click next, Select quantity and click pick, wait for 1 or two second Select lot number or serial number, and click assign quantity and wait for 1 or two second then select bin to place the item and click on place. the goal is to see which warehouse worker, work fast and not wasting time on picking. and now at the end screen, you can see that the time is longer than the normal time to spend on picking, and the device says you performed slower then average and he is unhappy with picking. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            Item Classification Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:31 PM Item Classification With the help of an analysis, it is possible to divide the items into different classes. We often talk about the ABC analysis here. ABC analysis is quite useful for the organization as it leads to: 1. Optimization of ABC Inventory Management function 2. Avoiding loss of business opportunities 3. Less stock handling costs for low-value items 4. Opportunity to convert Class B items into Class A Your A items are the ones that cost the most and are used the most, for example, raw materials that are used every day in production processes. Your B items are those that cost less and are used less frequently, for example, office supplies that don’t need constant replenishment but are expensive enough that they should still be always stocked. Your C items are those that cost the least and are used even less frequently,for example, spare parts for machines whose regular maintenance will keep them running without any issues for years without needing replacement parts. ABC analysis classifies inventory into 3 categories: Class A – forms 15% to 20% of the stock quantity but commands 80% to 85% of the total inventory value. Class A items should be managed very closely. Class B – forms 30% to 35% of the stock quantity but commands 10% to 15% of the inventory value. Class B items are the items that a business should closely monitor. Class C – forms 50% of the stock in terms of quantity but commands only 55% of the inventory value. Class C items are very low-value items that are not in high demand with the customers. Item classification in Business Central There are two ways to classify the items in Business Central: First: by opening an existing item and changing the item classification code. Second: create a new item and set the item classification code. First method: Open Business Central and click on the search button then type items and click the related link. Wait until the item card page loads now we are on the item cards page here we have many items. Last month I sold hawx 7X very much now I am going to classify this item to class A. Click on hawx 7X item once you see the item card page click on item classification then set the item in class A. This is how to change item classification. Second method: In this scenario you notice in market the an item has more demand in the whole market so you import or Open Business Central and click on the search button then type items and click the related link. Wait until the items card page loads, now we are on the item cards page here click on the plus or new button to create a new item card. Wait until the new item card page appears then fill in the item card necessary fields click on item classification and set the item class to A, B, or C as raw material is very important, so I put the item in Class A. Here I click to import a picture for the item for better identification of an item then close the item card and the card is created. Here is our created item in the items page. These were the common way for item classification.             Pack and Ship Modified on Mon, 22 Dec at 3:07 PM What is Pack and Ship Pack and ship are exactly as it sounds. It is the process of collecting the right items for an order (or orders), putting them into a box and/or packing materials, and then shipping them off to the customer. Sometimes this is shipment by shipment and sometimes in a bulk fashion. Preparations To make packing work properly, a few things need to be prepared. This is all done by the demo data. Setup Item category for packaging materials There must be an item category for packaging material, and it must contain one or more items. You can optionally set the GTIN or identifier, you can scan for the GTIN, Number, or Identifier. This category must then be set on the Warehouse Setup Report Selection To print the packing list, the package report must be linked within BC. Go to Business Central and click on the search button. Type custom report layout and select the related link. In custom report layouts you can see two different types of reports one is Microsoft Report Builder (RDLC) and the second is a Word Document. So these reports are very well featured because you can export the layout and make your changes then import the layout. This is one of the most important features of this kind of report. Custom report layout Packing Conditions However, there are several conditions that a warehouse shipment must meet before you can go to this screen: The warehouse shipment must have been picked up. Depending on the 'Shipping Advice' set on the order(s). If there is an order that must be Completely picked up on the warehouse shipment, then the warehouse shipment must be completely picked up before you can start packing. If 'Shipping Advice' is partial, you can also go packing if it has not yet been completely picked. You can never go to packing if nothing has been picked for the warehouse shipment yet. You also cannot go to packing if the warehouse shipment is completely loaded with the Load functionality. Packing steps on business central Go to Business Central, open the warehouse and logistic navigation menu, and then click on the warehouse shipment navigation bar. Note: There are two different ways to go to the pack and ship page: first, you need to go to the warehouse shipment list. The second way is to open a warehouse shipment. On the right side of the screen in warehouse shipment lists, you notice that the pack and ship button is deactivated, it is because the order must meet the minimum requirement of pack and ship to be processed. As a user guide, a check mark has been added to the warehouse shipment list that indicates whether a warehouse shipment is ready for packing or not. Select an order that has a checkmark for pack and ship. Click on pack and ship above the order under the navigation bar. Once the pack and ship page for a specific order opens then go to the next step. Packing flow and barcodes When you are in the packing process you will first see a screen that asks how many packages you think you will use for each order. This will be printed on the shipping label or labels. If you leave it 0 for 'estimated packages', the packing will not start until you enter the package number E.g. (1 or 2) then the packing screen opens. You can complete the packing process with barcodes. Enter the package number for example 1. Scan a package regarding your package size (PB1002), the meaning of this number is that you can choose your package size, and this packing slip ( PB1001) is the smallest package size and this packing slip indicates (pb1010) the largest package size. Note: there is a tool-tip! for every process that you're going to do on the top of the pack and ship page under the order number. Scan the item or license plates that would be inside the package. If the items have tracking information, then you will be able to see them here. Here you can also see the information about the license plate, item number, item name, and other information such as the unit of measure, quantity to ship, etc. When you have done all these steps then Click on Done Package or scan the barcode of the done package. Once everything is good then Clear the package by clicking its related button or scan the code. After all packages are scanned then click on ReadyToShip button or scan the ready-to-ship barcode. So if you would like to start a new package process click delete all or scan delete all barcodes to start a new process for packing the packages. What is the Sendcloud? Sendcloud is an all-in-one shipping platform for e-commerce that accelerates international growth. What does Sendcloud do? Sendcloud is a shipping platform that helps e-commerce businesses streamline operations related to delivery tracking, checkout, and order management. It is fully available in Supplychain365. Using Sendcloud we can print package labels for different carriers (PostNL, DHL, UPS, etc.). To work with Sendcloud it must be enabled in the warehouse setup. The login details must also be entered correctly. The party must provide private and public keys to access and change information. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            Priority Order Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:31 PM Priority Order What is priority order? If an order has priority, it is the most important order you have to do or deal with or must be done or dealt with before everything else you have to do. In this way, it is possible to give priority to specific picks because, for example, they need to be delivered today. In SupplyChain365 there is a priority option for sales orders, picking, and warehouse shipment. The steps to set priority to an order and show it to warehouse employees are: Open Business Central click on warehouse and logistics and select sales order. In the sales order page click on Create New Sales Order and select Plus button wait until the sales order page appears. Complete the sales order page customer name, contact and other details then click on priority order or toggle on the priority button. In the lines fast tab select item, no, description, location, and quantity this is enough information to create a priority order. Release the document and you will see that the document status changed to released. Click on Create Warehouse Shipment. In the warehouse shipment page control the information if everything is good then toggle on priority order, release the document, and click on create pick. Once the pick document is created then this order will be counted as an important order. Once you completed all the above steps then you will be able to see this order as a prioritized order on the mobile screen. To see prioritized orders in the mobile application, go to your mobile device open the supplychaine365 app, and log in with your credentials. once you log in click on the pick process and here you see all orders but orders with exclamation marks at the top of the orders are with priority. This is how to create an important order with priority in Business Central.             Reclassification Modified on Mon, 22 Dec at 3:08 PM Reclassification Reclassification SettingsFirst, activate the reclassify permission for the movement part of the warehouse groups. This permission can only be set for locations that do not have 'Directed Put-away and Pick' activated. This permission allows the warehouse worker to quickly move stock between bins and locations (for example, from HARDBOX to MIDBOX). Reclassification in the app after activating the setting then you see a button in the movement process order screen that allows the warehouse user to reclassify items, but only for moving them from one bin to another. This button has to be enabled for the warehouse group. This function enables warehouse users to transfer stock between bins and locations. The user enters the normal flow for creating new movements. instead of only being able to choose bins to place from the same location, the user can now select any bin from any non-directed location. If the user scans a bin that is present in more than one location, a pop-up appears, allowing the user to select the desired location. Steps: Open the SupplyChain365 application choose Warehouse and enter the main menu then select move and click Reclassify Select or scan bin Select item or license plate (regarding what you want to move) Select quantity and click on the place button Now select or scan a bin in place bin page Here you see all non directed location which can you move the selected item or license plate And finished now we are going to see if its processed or failed Yes running and refreshing after refreshing it is completed Thanks for watching stay tuned Add license plate to item reclassification journal in extension (SC365) there is a license plate field in item journal lines. These fields are specifically for Reclassification. There is now also a button to add a license plate to Reclassification, this uses the same license plate selection screen as is uses in the rest of the extension, it is filtered on all Locations that do not use Directed put-away and pick. The extension will now also handle license plates correctly in reclassification from the APP.             Replenishment on Demand Modified on Fri, 10 May, 2024 at 3:31 PM Introduction to replenishment on demand Replenishment on Demand is used to create movements to move stock from bulk to pick locations for sales orders/warehouse shipments. Preparation To make Replenishment on Demand work, BC must be setup correctly: The location must have directed put-away and pick enabled. There must be a bin type that can only be used for put-away, and there must be a bin type that can be picked from (Storage or pick zone). There should also be bins for this type, preferably in their own zone (E-01-02 or G-02-02) There should be some stock in these bins. Replenishment on Demand process in business central Replenishment on Demand can be found in the 'Tell me what you want to do' search function. (alt + q). Here you must specify the location and the type of document for which you want to calculate replenishment, then BC will calculate which movements are needed. You will then see by default which stock you are missing in your pick locations to fulfill the orders if it is present in your bulk. You can expand this even further by applying the different filters. image.png In the rightmost column, you can indicate what you want to move. Please note: If you choose stock that is on a license plate, pay attention to whether you are allowed to break it or not, depending on your location settings. If you click on the Propose Movement button, BC will open the movement worksheet and fill it with the movements proposed here. Here you can see exactly which movements BC will create, and you can further adjust and fine-tune it yourself.             SupplyChain365 Advance Settings Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 3:25 PM This article is about the advanced mobile settings for locations and document types. Processes can be adjusted at location and document level: (different handling in workflow documents for, for example, a specific customer, group or 3PL reception). The adjustment is set on the location card and can be overwritten with the settings on the documents. It is possible to work with workflows to change this for specific conditions (for a specific customer for example). Receive Settings For the mobile receive process, the following settings can be adjusted per location or document type. Require receive item scan: Requires the warehouse user to scan a received item. No manual input possible. Scan receive bin first: Requires the warehouse user to select the bin before selecting the item. Batch Posting: Warehouse user can select/scan all items before posting to Business Central Require scan every item: Warehouse user must select/scan all items (quantity page will not be shown) Allow over-receipt: Warehouse user is allowed to receive more quantity than is listed. Enable scanning of serial numbers: Warehouse user can scan serial numbers in lines pages. This option can impact performance for large orders. Use Suggested CrossDockBin in receiving: If a receipt contains many items, ensure that they are placed in the same bin. Scanning of a serial number is required: When this parameter is enabled a user must always scan a serial number, when multiple serial numbers are available to choose from. Enable license plate recording: Warehouse user is allowed to record license plates using the mobile app. Put-away Settings The mobile put-away process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings. Place all Items: Place all taken items on the same bin. Enable scanning of serial numbers: Warehouse user can scan serial numbers in lines pages. Always automatically create a put-away: Always create a put-away when the document queue processes a receipt line. Create a put-away when receipt complete: Only create a put-away by the document queue when the receipt is complete. Different Bin confirm required: When scanning a different bin when placing, you need to confirm the bin by scanning it again. Scanning of a Serial number is required: When this parameter is enabled a user must always scan a serial number, when multiple serial numbers are available to choose from. Pick Settings The mobile process pick can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings. Enable Batch Picking: Enable batch picking in the app. This parameter will automatically enable "Auto Open Line". Enabling "Allow Place on License Plates" is recommended. Create License Plates Batch Picking: Create license plates when warehouse user enters pick with multiple orders. Auto open Header: Automatically reserve and open a header. Auto open Line: Automatically reserve and open a line. Place all Items: Place all taken items on the same bin Require Scanning of Item: Require scanning of the item in the App Require Scanning of Item Identifier: Require scanning of the item identifier in the App. Item identifiers have to be defined for this to work! Enable scanning of serial numbers: Warehouse user can scan serial numbers in lines pages. Different Bin confirm required: When scanning a different bin when placing, you need to confirm the bin by scanning it again. Scanning of a serial number is required: When this parameter is enabled a user must always scan a serial number, when multiple serial numbers are available to choose from. Breakbulk flow required: When this parameter is enabled a user enters the flow for handling breakbulk lines when applicable. Show pick result screen: Show screen with stats about pick after pick is completed. Average Pick Time: Average time per pick line for use in pick result screen, in seconds. Movement Settings The mobile movement process can be adjusted on location and/or document with the following settings. Auto open Header: Automatically reserve and open a header. Auto open Line: Automatically reserve and open a line. Place all Items: Place all taken items on the same bin. Enable scanning of serial numbers: Warehouse user can scan serial numbers in lines pages. Different Bin confirm required: When scanning a different bin when placing, you need to confirm the bin by scanning it again. Scanning of a serial number is required: When this parameter is enabled a user must always scan a serial number, when multiple serial numbers are available to choose from. Automatically generate storage of complete receipts One task of the document Queue is to create a save when a receipt has been completely received. It is important to have the warehouse settings on the location in Business Central right. You will find this on the Location Card. If Use Put-Away Worksheet is disabled (A put away is always made for every incoming reception), we cannot set anything for put away in the mobile settings. The options Always automatically create a put-away or Create a put-away when receipt complete will complete) will not be available (disabled) If these options are disabled, you can indicate at document level (only the standard setting below) what should happen when a receipt is processed: You then get the same two options: Always automatically create a put-away or Create a put-away when receipt complete It is only possible to choose one of the two options, because they are opposites of each other. This can then be adjusted at document level and will be applied by the document Queue where necessary. document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            Understand the app queue and sessions Modified on Wed, 14 Feb, 2024 at 1:12 PM Part1 What is the app queue in the SupplyChain365 extension? A line or sequence of processes awaiting their turn to be attended to or to proceed. The App Queue process in Business Central: Go to Business Central and select role Supplychain365 Manager. Click on search and type application queue. You see SupplyChain365 Application Queue Click on it and you will see that we have many queues. Here you see various properties: queue type indicates in which process we are. document type indicates which document type is currently in the queue. document number, indicates the document number of the current queue, queue status indicates the current status of the queue. There are three types: pending: just wait until it's completed retry: if queue fails, retry it from here and wait for the result completed: when a queue is completed it will no longer show up here. It will automatically disappear from the application queue page. queued by: shows by which user the queues were done. Note: processes are executed by warehouse workers with mobile devices. Here in the application queue you have the general information regarding each user, process and process status. Part2 What is a warehouse session in the SupplyChain365 extension? A session is a group of user interactions with SupplyChain365 that take place within a given time frame. For example, a single session can contain multiple receipt, put away, movement, and picking actions. Go to Business Central and select role SupplyChain365 manager. Click on search and type session. Now see you Warehouse Session List. Click on it in order to see the list of sessions. Here we have some titles to understand the current session. Activity type: indicates that the current users are now busy with picking and receive, with these specified numbers and no one else can open these numbers. Document number: indicates in which document number or numbers users are busy with, and these numbers are just specified for current process and current user, and no one else can enter this session with the same number and process. Document line number: indicates the line numbers of the current processes. User indicates: how many users are in current session and operating these tasks. Group: indicates the group of users currently working. Session start: indicates when the current session started, including the date and time of the session. Queued: indicates which processes are in line.             All Workflow in SupplyChain365 Modified on Thu, 14 Mar, 2024 at 2:44 PM What is workflow? A workflow is a series of activities needed to complete a task. Workflow automation shifts the execution of those activities from humans to software. To automate a workflow To automate a workflow, an organization first identifies the tasks that make up the job. Next, it creates the rules and logic that govern how those tasks should be done. Finally, it programs the software with the predefined business rules and logic. The rules and logic are often a series of if-then statements that act like instructions telling the program what actions to take and how to move from one task to the next. The software uses those rules and logic to perform the series of tasks from start to finish, so that humans no longer need to handle the job. Workflow automation examples in Business Central: Below are five examples of tasks that workflow automation can handle in SupplyChain365: Create warehouse receipt, when an incoming 3PL order is released. Create incoming 3PL order, when and outgoing 3PL order is released. Create Document from EDI Document when EDI Document is added. Create transfer warehouse receipt when a transfer shipment is posted. Create warehouse shipment when a transfer order is released. How to use workflows in the warehouse process Go to Business Central, select the role of Supplychain365 manager. Click on search and type workflows. Select Workflows (Lists) and you will see that currently we have different workflows, but we can add more workflows or remove current workflows. The workflows are: 3PL Receipt: in 3PL receipt workflow screen you see: Code represents name of workflow. Description shows more information about the workflow. Category assign the current workflow for a specific user. Enabled: you must enable a workflow to use it in SupplyChain365 In workflow steps we have When event: Specifies the workflow event that triggers the related workflow response. On Condition: Specifies the condition that moderates the workflow event that you specified in the Event Description field. When you choose the field, the Event Conditions window opens in which you can specify condition values for predefined lists of relevant fields. Then response: Specifies the workflow response that is that triggered by the related workflow event. As a result: by enabling the workflow option, When an incoming 3PL order is released without any condition then create warehouse receipt. 3PL-Incoming: in 3PL incoming workflow screen you see: Code represents name of workflow. Description shows more information about the workflow. Category assign the current workflow for a specific user. Enabled: you must enable a workflow to use it in SupplyChain365 In workflow steps we have When event: Specifies the workflow event that triggers the related workflow response. On Condition: Specifies the condition that moderates the workflow event that you specified in the Event Description field. When you choose the field, the Event Conditions window opens in which you can specify condition values for predefined lists of relevant fields. Then response: Specifies the workflow response that is that triggered by the related workflow event. As a result: by enabling the workflow option, When an outgoing 3PL order is released without any condition then create incoming 3pl order. EDI - Documents: Electronic Data Interchange – or EDI – is the secure, automated exchange of electronic documents, such as purchase orders, invoices and delivery notes, between businesses or trading partners using a standardized format that allows different computer systems to communicate with each other. in Edi Document workflow screen, you see: Code represents name of workflow. Description shows more information about the workflow. Category assign the current workflow for a specific user. Enabled: you must enable a workflow to use it in SupplyChain365 In workflow steps we have When event: Specifies the workflow event that triggers the related workflow response. On Condition: Specifies the condition that moderates the workflow event that you specified in the Event Description field. When you choose the field, the Event Conditions window opens in which you can specify condition values for predefined lists of relevant fields. Then response: Specifies the workflow response that is that triggered by the related workflow event. As a result: by enabling the workflow option, when an outgoing 3PL order is released without any condition then create incoming 3pl order. Transfer: in transfer workflow screen you see: Code: represents name of workflow. Description: shows more information about the workflow. Category: assign the current workflow for a specific user. Enabled: you must enable a workflow to use it in SupplyChain365 In workflow steps we have When event: Specifies the workflow event that triggers the related workflow response. On Condition: Specifies the condition that moderates the workflow event that you specified in the Event Description field. When you choose the field, the Event Conditions window opens in which you can specify condition values for predefined lists of relevant fields. Then response: Specifies the workflow response that is that triggered by the related workflow event. As a result: by enabling the workflow option, when a transfer shipment is posted without any condition then create transfer warehouse receipt. Transfer – Ship: in transfer - ship workflow screen you see: Code: represents name of workflow. Description: shows more information about the workflow. Category: assign the current workflow for a specific user. Enabled: you must enable a workflow to use it in SupplyChain365 In workflow steps we have When event: Specifies the workflow event that triggers the related workflow response. On Condition: Specifies the condition that moderates the workflow event that you specified in the Event Description field. When you choose the field, the Event Conditions window opens in which you can specify condition values for predefined lists of relevant fields. Then response: Specifies the workflow response that is that triggered by the related workflow event. As a result: by enabling the workflow option, when a transfer order is released without any condition then create warehouse shipment. Create new workflow! There are three different ways in business central which you can create a workflow. New workflow from template The templates provide a fast way to create flows, because the trigger and some actions are automatically created and configured for you. Templates are also a good way to learn how to build your own flows. There are several templates that cover most of the entities in Business Central, like customers, items, sales orders, and so on. Each template is typically specific to the records in the page's source table. So, for example, if you create a flow based on the template named Block the selected customer in Business Central, the flow will appear on customer related pages, like Customers list and Customer card. Copy workflow. Simply copy existing workflow. Click on one of the workflows and select drop-down menu beside of new workflow from template. Make your changes. So now we have a copy of currently selected workflow. New: to create an instant flow, complete the following steps: Add a new flow from Business Central: Sign into Business Central. Click on search icon and type “workflow”. In the workflow screen, select New From new workflow from Template drop-down menu then click New. The workflow page opens and fill in the form: Code represents name of workflow. Type WAREHOUSE-PICK Description shows more information about the workflow. Type WAREHOUSE-PICK Category assign the current workflow for a specific user. Keep it blank. Enabled: you must enable it to use it in SupplyChain365 In workflow steps we have When event: click on chose a value, scroll down, and select Supplychain365: when a warehouse pick for a shipment is registered. On Condition: by default, it set to be always, but you can make changes on it. And here I set the value to default. Then response: click on select response and in chose a value I select show message and type my message “Pick Registered Successfully☺”. Close the window. Create new warehouse shipment Create pick for item to be shipped And register the pick to see the workflow. Note: Don’t forget to turn on “enable” option in the workflow page. document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            Assembly Order Modified on Mon, 17 Jun, 2024 at 1:35 PM Assembly Order Companies can supply products to customers by combining components without using manufacturing features. features for assembling items integrate with related features such as sales, planning, reservations, and warehousing. An assembly item is a sellable item that contains an assembly bill of material. Business Central lets you supply assembly items in the following ways: assemble to order assemble to stock Assemble to order Use the assemble-to-order process for items that you don't want to stock. for example, for the following reasons: you'll customize the items for customer requirements. you want to minimize the cost of on-hand inventory. Assemble to stock use the assemble-to-stock process for items that you assemble and store for future sales. assemble-to-stock items are standard items, such as packaged kits, that you don't customize. you can also consume these items as subassembly components. the items are picked and processed as single items and are treated as finished production items. The process to assemble items for order or stock is as follows: go to business central search for items by pressing the (alt + q) shortcut and open the related link. click on the replenishment fast tab under the item card page. on the right side you see assembly policy and here you can choose between assemble to stock and assemble to order. to sell an item that is assembled to order choose the search icon, enter the assembly order, and then choose the related link. click on Create New Assembly Order on the assembly order page. in the item number field, enter an item that is set up to be assembled to order. in the quantity field, enter how many units to sell. in the location code field, define which location the item will be sold from. the assembly process will occur at that location. Now we have an assembly order with assembly lines. The next step is to create a pick go to the warehouse tab and click on create a warehouse pick. One pick will be created and now register the pick from your device or Business Central. Follow the on-screen steps to register a pick for your device or from Business Central. once you register the pick then open the assembly order page, select the order which you have been picked from it, and open it after it opens click on post. The order is posted, and you can see it in the assembly line on the mobile application.             GS1 Steps and information Modified on Mon, 22 Dec at 3:09 PM GS1 Global standards Table of codes used in SupplyChain365 GS1-EAN(128) No Code Name Description 1 00 SSCC Serial Shipping Container Code 2 02 GTIN Global Trade Item Number 3 10 BATCH/LOT LOT0001234 4 11 PRODUCTION DATE 12-05-2025 5 12 DUE DATE 21-05-2025 6 13 PACK DATE 18-05-2025 7 15 BEST BEFORE 28-12-2027 8 17 EXPIRATION DATE 30-05-2028 9 37 QUANTITY 05 10 91 CUSTOMER Drone R us (K00100) Note: an explanation for the above abbreviations: GS1: Global Standard 1, an international standards organization with member bodies in more than 100 countries worldwide (GS1 US, GS1 CANADA, GS1 FRANCE, etc.). SSCC: Serial Shipping Container Code can be used by companies to identify a logistic unit, which can be any combination of trade items packaged together for storage and or transport purposes; for example, a case, pallet, or parcel. GTIN: Global Trade Item Number can be used by a company to uniquely identify all its trade items. GS1 defines trade items as products or services that are priced, ordered, or invoiced at any point in the supply chain. See how GTIN works. EAN: stands for the European Article Number, also named IAN (International Article Numbering). An international standard numbering and barcode system used primarily in retail applications developed by EAN International, compatible with the U.S Universal Product Code. Side Menu GS1 Note: Before using GS1 you must activate GS1 scanning in Business Central then you can use it in the supplychain365 mobile application. Steps to active GS1 in Business Central: Open business central Go to the warehouse and logistics navigation menu and select locations from its navigation bar. Select a location that you want to active GS1 Scroll down till you see supplychain365 mobile settings and then on receive settings toggle this option on Allow scanning GS1-128 barcodes Read GS1 Barcode: to read barcodes in GS1 format in supplychain365 follow these steps: First you must active the GS1 in the business central Open the supplychain365 application Login with your credentials Select company and environment Enter the warehouse to see the warehouse main menu page Click on the kabab menu on the top-left of the screen and click on read GS1 barcode With a handed scanner or device now scan any standard SSCC or GS1 code Here I create a bar code with Bartender software and then scan it to see how it works. Be with us till the end of the video. Receive Process GS1 Note: Before using GS1 and SSCC code you must activate some settings in Business Central then you can use them in the supplychain365 mobile application and Business Central extension. Steps to activate GS1 and SSCC in Business Central: Open business central Go to the warehouse and logistics navigation menu and select locations from its navigation bar. Select a location that you want to active GS1 and SSCC Scroll down till you find supplychain365 mobile settings and then on receive settings toggle this option on Allow scanning GS1-128 barcodes Ask to scan SSCC code Require the scanning of an SSCC code Enable license plate Recording Steps to use GS1 and SSCC in the supplychian365 mobile application: First you must activate the GS1 and SSCC options in business central Open the supplychain365 mobile application Login with your credential Select company and environment Enter the warehouse to see the warehouse main menu page Click on the receipt process and select the order from the list On this page click on the start license plate to start the LP recording Scan the GS1 code as shown on the pellet or box. Select bin location and click on stop license plate to stop LP recording. A popup textbox appears and you must scan the SSCC code, after that scan the license plate barcode, and close. How you can find License plate information in Business Central Open Business Central search for the license plate and click the related link On the license plate page click on the left side on the number to change its order to descending so you can see lastly created license plates. Here is the scanned license plate number, click it to open yes here is the internal identifier that we have scanned and the SSCC code also scroll down to see all information about the item. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            Getting started with the app queue Modified on Fri, 28 Jun, 2024 at 10:51 AM In the video below you find more information about the app queue. The app queue makes it possible to buffer orders while the warehouse employee is excute documents. Click on hamburger menu and select, App queue. here you can see all the application queues. By swiping right, you can see if the queue has an error. Here we see the last one has 2 errors; swipe right click on errors and see list of errors with error reasons. On the right side there is an indication of the status of the queue. It shows whether it is complete, not completed or retry. If completed that is good news we have no problem, but if it is not complete or indicate pending, swipe left click retry, the system checks if the problem is still available or resolved. but if it is not complete or indicate pending, swipe left click retry, then you will see that our current process show pending. now the system checks if the problem is still available or resolved. during a short time the process will change to complete . click on clear to clean the screen. you see that all other completed process ware clean but pending and uncompleted process are still here, waiting to be complete. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            How Unit of Measure feature works in mobile app Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:32 PM Introduction to SupplyChain365 mobile application Hamburger Menu. In this video, your able to do the following task. What is units of measure. The Unit of Measure (UOM): is the unit in which the quantity of an item is managed. For example, a product may be purchased in cases, stocked in boxes, and issued in single units. Various UOMs may exist for a single item. The term “unit of measure” can also refer to the way in which an item is measured. For example, an item may be measured by weight, by volume, or by length. When used in this context, the term “UOM” stands for “Unit of Measurement”. click on hamburger menu and select, Units of measure. with this option you can scan an item number or item identifier code to see information about its measurements, for example: number, description, unit of measure in box, in piece or in carton, quantity, length, width, height and weight. Click on item to update its unit of measure. Quantity is 1 in default, code is not changeable, enter 44 centimetre in length, enter 33 in width, enter 22 in height, select centimetre as volume unit of measure, enter 5 in weight and select kilogram as unit of measure. This is new adjustments click confirm to apply the changes. swipe right click on triangle to see item details, like, the item's measurements, for example: number, description, unit of measure in box, in piece or in carton, quantity, length, width, height and weight and a photo of item. at the bottom of screen you see print button, click on print, change printer setting regarding item. and print again. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            How the advanced inbound process with put-away works Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 5:03 PM What is the process of put away? Put away is the process of storing goods in a warehouse. It is a key component of warehouse management and logistics, as it involves picking items from inventory and placing them on a pallet or shelf. Put away begins with receiving goods into your warehouse, either through shipments or via an internal pull system. Open supply chain 3 65 and Log in to mobile device. Now when I click on the Put away, a new screen appears with bin codes select a bin or scan its code, now you see the information regarding the header of the item inside this bin. Swiping right, label printing. By swiping right, you can navigate to the item details. Click on the triangle icon in order to see all the item details like item number, description, variant, identifier, unit of measure and etc. At the bottom of the screen there is a print button. Click to see the printer options. Select a label, select a printer and enter the quantity to be printed. Clicking on item If you have a scanner just scan the item's code. If you don’t have a scanner, click on the item. Click Item number A, 880 and you see that we have 2 processes, one is take and other is place, here i put 5 and click on put-away. In this screen you see item tracking for put away, also there is information regarding item, Description, bin and quantity.It is important that how many we take from here and then place to somewhere else. When you see a selected item with orange background it means that we are taking items, when click on place select where to place the item in which location or bin select one and click next, Show the item number with item details, click next or scan the code, and the place screen is visible click place and chose quantity add quantity to then click done or scan the code to place the put-away item . Now you see on the right side of item 0 to take, 5 placed and total 22 item. Items placed in selected location. In a warehouse, put away refers to all the processes that happen between receiving goods from vendors and having them all put away into their assigned places. Having a put away system simplifies the process of storing items, reduces the risk of misplacing or losing items, and keeps your warehouse clean and organized. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            How the inbound process with receive works Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 4:29 PM In the video below we will show you how to create warehouse receipts using the supplychain365 mobile app for business central. We will go through all the required steps. What is a warehouse receipt? A warehouse receipt is a document that contains items that are received and sent immediately or possibly stored in the warehouse. A warehouse receipt can be made of a purchase order, a sales return order or an incoming 3PL order. Documents must be released in business central in order to create a warehouse receipt (For more information on how to create warehouse receipts click here). Login to mobile device (For more information go to the video “login to supplychian365 using mobile device”) Enter your username and password. Use your Microsoft Account for this. Click on sign in and verify your account with Microsoft two-factor authentication if required. Select an environment, then select a company and click login. Current users are allowed to access the warehouse and transport modules regarding their role. Here I click on warehouse, which leads to the warehouse menu, where you can see all information regarding warehouse management. The numbers in the upper right corner of the menu items indicate the number of open tasks. Now when I click on the receipt, a new screen appears with the information regarding the header of the item. By swiping right, you can navigate to the item details. Click on the triangle icon in order to see all the item details like item number, location (which is corebox), external document number, weight, volume, and the quantity, which is five. At the bottom of the screen there is a print button. Click to see the printer options. Select a label, select a printer and enter the quantity to be printed. Click on print for the the label to be printed and shall be used in item. See the video at getting start about adding labels and printers. Clicking on item If you have a scanner just scan the item's code. If you don’t have a scanner, click on the item. See you the list select first one and chose a location select quantity all or just a part of item and click receive select or scan lot number again enter quantity and click add quantity. Here is the total quantity in this lot and here is that we selected. Click done.             How to Execute Movements from the Mobile APP Modified on Tue, 2 Jan, 2024 at 4:43 PM Movement Goods Movements within the Warehouse. For every goods movement in (WMS) or warehouse management system, you move materials from one storage type to another based on a transfer order. You record all material information that is relevant for goods movements in the transfer order. Log in to the SupplyChain365 mobile application and click on move process. Execute movement created in Business Central: Click on button move. Here you see if we have movements registered in business central. Click on item. This is take screen, Select or scan bin. In here, you see go to bin you can select different bin also in the middle of screen we have information about item, its variant, quantity and movement number. click next. Now take item, scan or select item click next Movement quantity, select how much would you like to move, then click move. This is Place screen, Select or scan bin, in place screen scan the bin place the item, scan or select the item to be placed and click next, Movement quantity, select how much would you like to place, than click place. this is how to use mobile application for movement execution in business central. Create a new movement directly by the mobile application: Click new to register new movement via mobile application, here are the steps. Click new button, This is take screen, create new movement order, Select or scan a bin code where you want to take item, Select item and enter quantity to move than click on move, Click on place to see place screen, This is place screen. Select or scan bin which you want to place the item, Select item or scan item number or identifier code, click next. Select quantity to place and click place button. New movement executed. Note: to see the movement you need to login to business central and see all registered and other movement documents.             How to Receive a Large Number of License Plate Modified on Mon, 22 Dec at 3:09 PM How to receive a large number of license plate This is very important when you receive articles or items in a larger amount inside a license plate or pallets, so we need an automatic technique to do this job. In supplychain365 we need to activate a few settings and the job is done. So, let’s start the process step by step: Open Business Central click on the search button and type purchase order to create a purchase order, from the purchase order create a warehouse receipt. Click here for a full tutorial about creating purchase orders and warehouse receipts. Creating purchase order Complete the form and add items or articles then click on Create warehouse receipt. On the warehouse receipt page click on supplychain365 on the right side of the mobile setting to activate these buttons. Enable license plate recording: when you toggle this button on you see some other buttons are available. And toggle on automatically start license plate recording that is newly available after activating the first button. That was on supplychain365 in Business Central now I show you the rest in the supplychain365 mobile application. Open the supplychain365 mobile application and in the warehouse main menu click on receipt process. The first line is the newly created receipt so open it. After clicking on it you will see a popup message box with a close button and the license plate recording is started as you see in the application. Go further and select all lines after selecting them stop the license plate recording. The license plate is recorded, and you can see the license plate information in Business Central by searching for license plates. This is what it looks like after recording and these are the items inside the license plate. For more information about license plate and license plate recording please click here.             How to register defects and add photos in the logistic process Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:32 PM What is a product defect A product defect is any characteristic of a product that hinders its usability for the purpose for which it was designed and manufactured. product defects arise most prominently in legal contexts regarding product safety. How to report a defect in the mobile application with a photo. Log in to the Supply Chain 3 65 mobile application and click on any process, where you have seen a defect. For example, I have seen a defect during the put away process, in an item, click on the put away and select one of the receipt orders. In the upper right corner of the mobile application, you see a kebab menu. Click on it and select Report defect. we are in bin receive 1, so we select our item from this bin. Here we scan the item with the scanner or simply click on the item, on the report defect page Select how much of the item is bad or not working. You can also select a reason. The reasons are: External defect: damage caused by external action. ( selected as example ) Internal defect: damage caused by internal action. Color: deviation in color or color does not match. Click confirm, select lot number and quantity again and click done. Now a photo screen appears. If all steps were good, click new, take photos and click confirm. Now a damage report on that specific item has been saved. Once you click on that specific item you will find out that the item has been reported as damaged. Here you can make a new damage report if you want. Recording a new damage report if you see another defect in this item you can click new to make a new report on same item, the process is simple and it is the same as you record a defect. This is how to add a new damage report to an item with an existing damage report. in part 2 of tutorial you will see defects and other related options on how to report defect in business central. Click here for Part2: How to handle defects in SupplyChain365 (Business Central) Below a video to understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            How to show item availability on the mobile app Modified on Thu, 2 May, 2024 at 2:31 PM Introduction to Supply Chain 3 65 mobile application Hamburger Menu In this video, your able to do the following task. how to show item availability. Click on hamburger menu and select, Item availability. this option allows you to find out how many items are available in the various bins or locations. Here I scan The Hummingbird with item number A00881 and identifier 12345006; Unit of measure: piece (stuks); and no variant. You can scan an item number or item identifier code in order to see information about the item's measurements, for example: number, description, unit of measure in box, in piece or in carton, quantity, length, width, height and weight. on the right side shows total items, available items and the measurement of an item which is in pieces. also some item has L P number, which it means License plate number with the license plate number you will be able to track item. swipe right click on triangle to see item details, like, the item's measurements, for example: number, description, unit of measure in box, in piece or in carton, quantity, length, width, height and weight and a photo of item. at the bottom of screen you see print button, click on print, change printer setting regarding item. and print again. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };

            Sorry! nothing found for

            License Plate(APP) Modified on Tue, 27 Feb, 2024 at 2:48 PM What is a license plate? A license plate is a number assigned to each containment unit, which allows for better grouping and management of inventory. License plate in supplychain365 mobile application Open the supplychain365 mobile application and log in with your credentials (username and password). See how to log in to supplychain365 tutorials Click on the license plate process in the main menu, in this menu we have the following processes: Create a license plate: click on Create LP enter how many license plates you created and click ok, I have 5 license plates created, this screen asks if you would like to close the popup or print the license plates. Note: by printing the license plate number you can use them on pallets or keep a record for yourself. Print license plate: click on the print license plate to print a specific license plate, here you can enter the license plate number manually or simply scan the license plate barcode by a barcode scanner. After scanning information about the license plate number, identifier, location, and description appears and this is the printed version of the current license plate. Add or remove items from a license plate: click on LP items plus or minus to add or remove items, and scan or enter the license plate number to see its information, once the information appears, regarding a specific license plate you can see license plate content here, we have items or other child license plates in this section if it is present then you see then here. here you can select the item or license plate if you want to remove them from the current license plate just enter how many of the items you want to remove, select lot or serial if available then choose bin and click enter. Delete license plate: click on the delete a license plate button to remove a specific license plate by scanning the bar code or manually entering the license plate number. Once you find the license plate you see a confirm popup then click yes if you want to delete the license plate or click no if you mistakenly select the license plate. Note: you can delete license plates that have the states of empty or new and if a license plate has an item or other child license plate first you must remove them and then delete the license plate.             Mobile login and application overview Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 5:01 PM Below there is a video about how to login and a overview of the application. Open SupplyChain365 application and wait for login screen to appear. Login to mobile device (more information login to Supplychain365 using mobile device) Enter username and password. These are the QR codes for username and password scan and login. Note: to make your desired QR Code from text or email, search online for QR Code Designer or click here. Click on login and verify your account with Microsoft two-factor authentication (If available). Select an environment and a sandbox in the form below the supplychain365 logo. Then select company with the demo data and press login. The modules are shown. The user can access the warehouse and transport modules regarding their role. The numbers in the upper right corner of the blocks indicate the number of open tasks to do. Extra options that are always avaiable in the mobile app: Click on the hamburger menu in the upper left side of screen. Here you will see the following options: Change warehouse: this allows you to switch between different warehouses. For example: easybox, corebox, skubox or transbox. (for more information click here.) App Queue: here you can see all the application queues. By swiping right you can see if the queue has an error. On the right side there is an indication of the status of the queue. It shows whether it is complete, not completed or retry. Bin Contents: here you can scan a bin and see its contents or availability. (for more information click here.) Item availability: this option allows you to find out how many items are available in the various bins or locations in the warehouse. (for more information click here.) Units of Measure: with this option you can scan an item or item code to see information regarding its units of measurement, for example: in box, in piece, height, weight, length. (For more information click here.) Select Bluetooth Device: here you can connect a Bluetooth device. Logout: log out current user . Exit: completely close the application and all login sessions. About: displays the copyright information and current version of the software.             Record the License plate on the Receipt process Modified on Wed, 6 Mar, 2024 at 10:21 AM Part 1: Record a regular license plate Record the License plate on the Receipt process Open the supplychain365 mobile application and log in with your credentials (username and password). For more information See how to log in to supplychain365 tutorials Click on the receipt process button on the receive order page then select or scan an order from the list. Click on the start a license plate lp-button, here you see a record icon appear this means that we are currently recording or adding items to the license plate. Select the item, select the bin to receive and the item quantity, and press enter, now the item is selected, and continue these steps till you finish receiving all items. Once finished click on the stop license plate or Stop LP button and the last step is to click on the receive button. Item received and one license plate recorded in supplychain365 extension on business central. How to open the last recorded license plate in Business Central, open business central click on the warehouse and logistic navigation menu, and from its navigation bar select license plates, On the left side of the screen you see number click on number filtering to sort license plates in descending order if there is a lot of license plates in the list. And click on the last License plate number this is what you have recorded and here you see the lines and history of the license plate and item inside of it. Part2: Record a license plate with an internal identifier All the steps are similar to part one of recording a license plate but first, you have to toggle on some settings in the supplychain365 extension on Business Central. Open Business Central, click on the warehouse and logistic navigation menu, and click on the location on the navigation bar. Select corebox, and scroll down until you find the supplychain365 mobile settings fast tab. On receive settings, toggle on enable license plate recording, after enabling this option other options will be available, and you would toggle on require scanning of a license plate and scan license plate after pressing the stop recording options. We need these options to record a license plate on an internal identifier. The difference from part one is that you can scan or set an internal identifier and that is visible on business central. Note: You can choose all options if you think you need them.             Screen Orientation Settings Modified on Wed, 6 Mar, 2024 at 10:25 AM Hamburger menus Screen Orientation Settings Introduction to SupplyChain365 mobile application Hamburger Menu In this video, You can do the following task. How to change screen orientation? click on the hamburger menu and select the screen orientation setting. On the screen orientation setting page, we have three options Landscape: by clicking the landscape button, the screen orientation will change and from now on you will be using the supplychain365 application in landscape mode. Portrait: by clicking the portrait button, the screen orientation will change and from now on you will be using the supplychain365 application in portrait mode. Free turn: by clicking this option your device will be adjusted automatically, for example, if you change the device direction the application automatically changes its direction to landscape or portrait as your device. Note: by default, it has been configured as your device’s default setting.             Show content of a bin on the mobile app Modified on Thu, 21 Dec, 2023 at 4:32 PM In this video we introduce the hamburger menu in the SupplyChain365 mobile application. Click on hamburger menu and select, Bin Contents. A bin is the smallest unit of space where your items are stored. Here you can scan a bin and see its content or availability. Also you can enter number manually for example SHIP01. You can see the list of items on this bin in location CORE BOX and zone. Lets scan the code, this is the ship 01 barcode. Swiping right an item, you can navigate to the item details. Click on the triangle icon in order to see all the item details like item number, description, variant, identifier etc. Click on print to print the above information on a label through a zebra label printer. By swiping left, you see an item tracking icon that shows item tracking. Swipe and click on it to see the item tracking information. If you scan a bin without items, it shows “empty bin”. For example: bin RECEIVE-01 is an empty. When you scan it, you will see a message that the bin is empty. If we scan a barcode and see this message bin not found it means that we have no bin, or the bin has been deleted.             SupplyChain365 Column Chooser Modified on Tue, 13 Aug, 2024 at 9:31 AM SupplyChain365 Column Chooser What is a column chooser? The column chooser allows a user to change the set of columns at runtime. It is configured using the column chooser object and may operate in two modes: the default drag and drop mode and the select mode designed for touch devices. Supplychain365 uses the select mode. Supplychain365 column chooser Important to note that it is possible to choose columns in the mobile app that are shown in the mobile flow. So, it is possible to show the specific columns that are important for a user in for example the receive or pick process. How to activate column chooser in the supplychain365 extension Go to Business Central click on the search button type warehouse group click the related button and then follow the steps: On the warehouse groups page select a location then on this page click on column chooser or scroll down to find column chooser. select the process in which you want to set column chooser for example receives process click on to column chooser button to open the column chooser page. In column chooser receive page you can add your pre-defined column choosers. Select three dots on the right side of the screen option then select code for example receipt line. In field description select what options will be shown in column chooser. In the label section you can see the abbreviation of the description, so this label is also shown in the mobile app. In the order field you can set the order of the columns. below a video to help users understand the steps visually: document.querySelectorAll('.portal-attachment-thumbnail-img').forEach(function(img) { img.addEventListener('error', function () { attachment_error_image(this); }); }); const attachment_error_image = (attachment) => { const parentElement = attachment.parentElement; const defaultIcon = `${escapeHtml(attachment.dataset.extension)}`; parentElement.innerHTML = defaultIcon; };
